task.title: Reactivation of the Desiccant Bags and the Humidity Indicator

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

l1item.para: Reactivate the humidity indicator as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the locknut and the two rubber gaskets from the humidity indicator.
Put the humidity indicator body in the oven until the pink paper becomes blue.
Install the two rubber gaskets and the locknut on the humidity indicator body.
Put the humidity indicator in a (PWC05-054)polyethylene bag and seal it to keep moisture out of the indicator.

l1item.para: Reactivate the desiccant bags as follows:

l2item.para: Put the desiccant bags in the NAoven for 3 hours.
Put the desiccant bags in a (PWC05-054)polyethylene bag and seal them to keep moisture out of the bags.

l1item.para: These instructions are to make sure that a PW617F-E engine will produce the rated power within required limits after repair or normal scheduled overhaul.

The performance of a turbine engine is greatly affected by atmospheric conditions, so it is very important to make accurate records of the values of the barometric pressure and the bellmouth air inlet temperature at the time of the engine test.
It is recommended that all the instruments used for engine testing be calibrated at regular intervals.

You must have a test stand that is correlated to the applicable P&WC standards to do the engine test. The necessary data for the overhaul test stand correlation is available by contacting Pratt & Whitney Canada, Test Cell Support.

The procedures that follow to prepare an engine for test are suitable for a particular test cell arrangement. Overhaul facilities with a different test cell arrangement may use a modified procedure with different special tools to suit their particular test cell. For assistance contact P&WC Test Cell Support.
If the test results for any component or system of the engine are unsatisfactory during the engine test, the problem must be corrected before you continue with the test.

If a problem had to be corrected, a penalty run must be done before the engine can be accepted. The penalty run, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-01, (Task 72-00-00-760-807), will not be more severe or longer than the initial test.

If the chip detector light comes on during the engine test, after investigation the engine must be run for a minimum of one hour without the chip detector light coming on. The one hour engine run should be done using the penalty run procedure, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-01, (Task 72-00-00-760-807).

warning.para: WEAR EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU ARE NEAR AN ENGINE THAT IS INSTALLED IN THE TEST STAND. PARTS OF THE TEST EQUIPMENT OR FUEL AND OIL LEAKAGE CAN CAUSE INJURY.
DO NOT TOUCH THE ENGINE IMMEDIATELY AFTER IT WAS SHUTDOWN. SOME SURFACES STAY HOT FOR A PERIOD OF TIME AND CAN CAUSE AN INJURY.

l1item.para: General

warning.para: WEAR EAR PROTECTION WHEN YOU ARE NEAR AN ENGINE THAT IS ON. TURBINE ENGINES MAKE SUFFICIENT NOISE TO CAUSE TEMPORARY OR PERMANENT HEARING DAMAGE.

l1item.para: Engine Noise

warning.para: DO NOT TOUCH THE IGNITION CABLES OR IGNITERS UNLESS THE IGNITION EXCITER IS DISCONNECTED. SECONDARY EXCITER VOLTAGES CAN KILL.

l1item.para: Engine Ignition

caution.para: BEFORE YOU START THE ENGINE MAKE SURE THERE ARE NO LOOSE OBJECTS IN OR NEAR THE INLET DUCT. SUCTION FROM THE ENGINE CAN PULL THEM INTO THE ENGINE AND CAUSE INTERNAL DAMAGE.

l1item.para: Air Intake

taskproc.title: Engine Test Data Identification (Symbols and Abbreviations)

l1item.para: Table gives a list of the abbreviations and symbols used in the test procedures.

entry.para: Movement of TLA between two stops in 1 second or less.
Time to Ground Idle from Starter On
Time to light from Fuel On

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Installation of the Drain Bottles

l1item.para: Install the (PWC66133) drain bottle on the overboard drain elbow fitting of the AGB as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the overboard drain elbow fitting with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the overboard drain elbow fitting of the AGB. Torque the drain bottle nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the overboard drain fitting of the FMU as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the overboard drain fitting on the FMU with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the overboard drain fitting of the FMU. Torque the drain bottle nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the gas generator drain fitting as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the gas generator drain fitting with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the gas generator drain fitting. Torque the drain bottle nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm).

graphic.title: Drain Bottles - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Drain Bottle onto the Bleed Valve Actuator

l1item.para: Lubricate the threads of the drain fitting on the bleed valve actuator with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the (PWC66133)drain bottle on the drain fitting. Torque the drain bottle nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm).

graphic.title: Drain Bottle onto Bleed Valve Actuator - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Velocity Transducer (Plane 3)

l1item.para: Install the P/N CEC-4-130-0128velocity transducer (DRY) in the transducer vibration bracket with your hand.
With the (PWC68764)transducer socket, torque the velocity transducer 32 to 36 lbf.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm).
Install the (PWC69299)slave bung plug as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the slave bolt (P/N MS9556-08) with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the (PWC69299)slave bung plug on the bypass duct service fairing with the slave washer (P/N MS9321-09) and slave bolt.
Torque the slave bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Velocity Transducer - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the P3 Bleed Covers

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69327)P3 bleed cover on the oil and bleed air fairing.
Install the U-ring seal detail 4( PWC69327) on the (PWC69327)P3 bleed cover and oil and bleed air fairing.

Install the clamp detail 3( PWC69327) to attach the ( PWC69327)P3 bleed cover to the oil and bleed air fairing. Torque the nut on the
clamp detail 3( PWC69327) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: Repeat steps (1) to (3) on the opposite side of the engine.

graphic.title: P3 Bleed Covers - Installation

subtask.title: Engine Main Oil Pressure (MOP) - Nominal Setting

l1item.para: Remove the two nuts, washers, and bolts that attach the flange and bracket to the oil pump, and remove the flange.

caution.para: DO NOT USE TOOLS TO SEAT THE COLD START VALVE.

l1item.para: Lightly turn the cover CW to make sure that the cold start valve is fully seated in the oil pump, then turn the cover CCW 15 tangs.
Remove the cover, align the X mark with the upper bolt hole on the oil pump and reinstall the cover on the oil pump.

Lubricate the threads of the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Align the slots in the flange with the tangs on the cover and install the flange and bracket on the oil pump with the two bolts, washers, and nuts. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Engine Main Oil Pressure (MOP) - Nominal Setting

subtask.title: Installation of the Fuel Inlet and Motive Flow Adapters

l1item.para: Lubricate the threads on the motive flow fitting of the FMU with (PWC03-001) engine oil. Install the (PWC69157) motive flow adapter on the motive flow fitting of the FMU. Torque the coupling nut 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm).

Lubricate the threads on the fuel inlet fitting of the FMU with (PWC03-001) engine oil. Install the (PWC68782) fuel inlet adapter on the fuel inlet fitting of the FMU. Torque the adapter 75 to 80 lbf.in. (8.5-9.0 Nm).

graphic.title: Fuel Inlet and Motive Flow Adapters - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Engine Front Mounts

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69289)front mount on the upper mount pad as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the four slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) with (PWC06-004) antiseize compound.
Install the (PWC69289)front mount on the upper mount pad with the four slave washers (P/N MS35338-45) and slave bolts. Torque the slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) 110 to 120 lbf.in. (12.4-13.5 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69289)front mount on the lower mount pad as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the four slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) with (PWC06-004) antiseize compound.
Install the (PWC69289)front mount on the lower mount pad with the four slave washers (P/N MS35338-45) and slave bolts. Torque the slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) 110 to 120 lbf.in. (12.4-13.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Engine Front Mounts - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the AGB Static Pressure Tool

l1item.para: Remove the drain plug from the AGB.

Make sure that the packing detail 4( PWC68891) on the
connector detail 3( PWC68891) is serviceable. Replace the
packing detail 4( PWC68891) if required.

Install the (PWC68891)AGB static pressure tool on the AGB. Torque the
connector detail 3( PWC68891) 40 to 50 lbf.in. (4.5-5.6 Nm).

graphic.title: AGB Static Pressure Tool - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Starter Pad Adapter

l1item.para: Lubricate the four studs on the starter pad of the AGB with (PWC03-001) engine oil.

Install the starter pad adapter detail 2( PWC69322) on the starter pad of the AGB with the 16 washers detail 5( PWC69322) and four
nuts detail 4( PWC69322) . Torque the nuts 150 to 170 lbf.in. (16.9-19.2 Nm).

note.para: Install four washers under each nut.

graphic.title: Starter Pad Adapter - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Spacer Tube

l1item.para: Loosen the two bolts that attach the fuel tube to the FMU.

Lubricate the threads of the (PWC69482) spacer tube with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the (PWC69482)spacer tube on the two fuel tubes. Torque the coupling nuts of the fuel tubes 450 to 500 lbf.in. (50.8-56.5 Nm).
Torque the two bolts that attach the fuel tube to the FMU 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Spacer Tube - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the MOP and MOT Probe

l1item.para: Make sure that the packing detail 4( PWC69175) on the (PWC69175)MOT and MOP probe is serviceable. Replace the packing detail 4( PWC69175) if required.

Lubricate the threads of the studs on the AGB with ( PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the (PWC69175) MOT and MOP probe on the AGB with the two slave nuts (P/N ST3030-09). Torque the slave nuts 24 to 36 lbf.in. (2.7-4.1 Nm).

graphic.title: MOP and MOT Probes - Installation

task.title: Install the Engine in the Test Cell

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Installation of the Engine Lifting Sling

l1item.para:
Lubricate the four bolts detail 3( PWC69357) with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the (PWC69357)lifting bracket on the rear side of the bypass duct flange with eight washers detail 2( PWC69357) , and four
bolts detail 3( PWC69034) and nuts detail 4( PWC69034) . Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the (PWC69262)lifting sling on the three lifting brackets with the three ball lock pins detail 1( PWC69262) .
With a suitable lifting device, put the engine in the test cell next to the test cell stand.

graphic.title: Engine Lifting Sling - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Engine onto the Front Mount Yoke

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69173)front mount yoke on the test cell stand with the four lock washers detail 4( PWC69173) and bolts detail 5( PWC69173) . Torque the bolts 1200 to 1300 lbf.in. (135.6-146.8 Nm).
Install the rear mount assembly (P/N LM-471-SA4) on the test cell stand with the four lock washers (P/N W-344) and bolts (P/N SA-29). Torque the bolts 180 lbf.in. (20.3 Nm).
Install the two (PWC69289) front mounts on the (PWC69173) front mount yoke as follows:

l2item.para:
Install the two (PWC69289) front mounts on the (PWC69173) front mount yoke with the two
washers detail 8( PWC69173) ,
bolts detail 9( PWC69173) ,
washers detail 8( PWC69173) , and
castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) .
Torque the two castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) 20 lbf.in. (2.2 Nm).

Increase the torque of the two
castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) up to 25 lbf.in. (2.8 Nm) until the slots in the castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) line up with the holes in the bolts detail 9( PWC69173) .
Install the two safety pins detail 12( PWC69173) in the bolts detail 9( PWC69173) and castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) .

graphic.title: Engine onto the Front Mount Yoke - Installation

subtask.title: Removal of the Engine Lifting Sling

l1item.para: Remove the three ball lock pins detail 1( PWC69262) that attach the ( PWC69262)lifting sling to the three lifting brackets, and remove the (PWC69262) lifting sling.

Remove the four nuts detail 4( PWC69357) ,
bolts detail 3( PWC69357) , and eight washers detail 2( PWC69357) that attach the (PWC69357)lifting bracket to the rear side of the bypass duct flange, and remove the (PWC69357)lifting bracket.

graphic.title: Engine Lifting Sling - Removal

subtask.title: Installation of the Vibration Bracket (Plane 1)

l1item.para: Remove the two nuts and three bolts, that attach the harness bracket and front lifting bracket to the fan case, and remove the front lifting bracket. Keep the front lifting bracket and hardware as a set.

Lubricate the threads of the two long
bolts detail 4( PWC69161) with (PWC03-001) engine oil.

Lubricate the threads of the short
bolt detail 7( PWC69161) with (PWC06-004) antiseize compound.

Install the (PWC69161)vibration bracket and harness bracket on the fan case with the three washers detail 5( PWC69161) , two long
bolts detail 4( PWC69161) and nuts detail 6( PWC69161) , and the one short
bolt detail 7( PWC69161) and washer detail 5( PWC69161) . Torque the two nuts and the short bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: Do not install a washer under the bolt head at the harness bracket location.

graphic.title: Vibration Bracket (Plane 1) - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Instrument Duct

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69594)exhaust protector on the exhaust cone.

Lubricate the threads of the 21 bolts detail 2( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the (PWC69144)instrument duct on the bypass duct with 21
bolts detail 2( PWC69144) , washers detail 3( PWC69144) , and nuts detail 4( PWC69144) . Tighten the nuts and bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the threads of the 14 bolts detail 2( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the engine mount bracket on the bypass duct with 14
bolts detail 2( PWC69144) and nuts detail 4( PWC69144) . Tighten the nuts and bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the threads of the nine
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001) engine oil. Install the nine
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) on the (PWC69144)instrument duct. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

Torque all the nuts detail 4( PWC69144) and the
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69594)exhaust protector from the exhaust cone.

graphic.title: Instrument Duct - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Engine onto the Rear Mount Assembly

l1item.para: Install the engine mount assembly in the rear mount assembly (P/N LM-471-SA4) as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the two bolts (P/N NAS6204-11) with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Install the engine mount assembly in the rear mount assembly (P/N LM-471-SA4) with the two washers (P/N MS9321-11), bolts (P/N NAS6204-11), washers (P/N MS9321-11), and castle nuts (P/N AN310C4).
Torque the two castle nuts (P/N AN310C4) 125 lbf.in. (14.1 Nm).
Increase the torque of the two castle nuts (P/N AN310C4) up to 170 lbf.in. (19.2 Nm) until the slots in the castle nuts (P/N AN310C4) line up with the holes in the bolts.
Install the two safety pins (P/N 142-153) in the bolts (P/N NAS6204-11) and castle nuts (P/N AN310C4).

graphic.title: Engine onto the Rear Mount Assembly - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the P15/T15 Rakes and Plugs onto the Instrument Duct

l1item.para: Install the four (PWC69152) P15/T15 rakes as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the sixteen (16)
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil .

Install each (PWC69152)P15/T15 rake on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with a (PWC62833) gasket, four
washers detail 3( PWC69144) and four
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) .
Torque the bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the four (PWC69212) P15/T15 rake plugs as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the sixteen (16)
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil .

Install each (PWC69212)P15/T15 rake plug on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with a (PWC62833) gasket, four
washers detail 3( PWC69144) and four
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) .
Torque the bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: P15/T15 Rakes and Plugs onto the Instrument Duct - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the P6 and T6 Rakes and Plugs onto the Instrument Duct

l1item.para: Install the four (PWC69149) T6 rakes as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the 16
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil.

Install each (PWC69149)T6 rake on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with a (PWC62832) gasket, four
washers detail 3( PWC69144) and
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) .
Torque the bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the three (PWC69153) P6 rakes as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the 12
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil.

Install each (PWC69153)P6 rake on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with a (PWC62832) gasket, four
washers detail 3( PWC69144) and
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) .
Torque the bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the four (PWC69213) P6/T6 rake plugs as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the 16
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil.

Install each (PWC69213)P6/T6 rake plug on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with a (PWC62832) gasket, four
washers detail 3( PWC69144) and
bolts detail 7( PWC69144) .
Torque the bolts detail 7( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: P6 and T6 Rakes and Plugs onto the Instrument Duct - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the −5% Exhaust Nozzle

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69463)−5% exhaust nozzle as follows:

l2item.para:
Lubricate the threads of the 16
bolts detail 2( PWC69144) with (PWC03-001)engine oil.

Install the (PWC69463)−5% exhaust nozzle on the (PWC69144) instrument duct with the 16
bolts detail 2( PWC69144) ,
washers detail 3( PWC69144) , and
nuts detail 4( PWC69144) .
Torque the nuts detail 4( PWC69144) 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Exhaust Nozzle - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Bellmouth Transition Duct

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct on the fan case as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the 14 slave bolts (P/N MS9557-12) with (PWC03-001) engine oil.

Install the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct on the fan case with the 14 slave washers (P/N MS9321-10), slave bolts (P/N MS9557-12), and slave nuts (P/N ST3030-10). Tighten the slave nuts with your hand.
Make sure that the inside radial face of the ( PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct is even with the fan case. Torque the 14 slave nuts (P/N ST3030-10) 85 to 95 lbf.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm).

l1item.para: Press on the clamp and install the T1 sensor in the hole on the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct, then release the clamp.

graphic.title: Bellmouth Transition Duct - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Bellmouth Inlet

l1item.para: Do a visual inspection to make sure that the ( PWC69209)bellmouth screen is free of damage and there is no foreign objects around or behind the fan.
Align the (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet with the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct as follows:

l2item.para: Install the (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet on the turnbuckle clevis.
Adjust the turnbuckle clevis until the flange of the ( PWC69142)bellmouth inlet is parallel and concentric with the flange on the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet on the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct as follows:

l2item.para: Install the (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet on the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct with the ( PWC69156)V-band clamp.
Install the four ball lock pins detail 13( PWC69142) on the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct and (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet.
Torque the nut on the (PWC69156) V-band clamp 45 to 60 lbf.in. (5.1-6.8 Nm).
With a soft faced hammer, tap the circumference of the ( PWC69156)V-band clamp to seat it on the flanges of the (PWC69142) bellmouth inlet and the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct.
Retorque the nut on the (PWC69156) V-band clamp 45 to 60 lbf.in. (5.1-6.8 Nm).

graphic.title: Bellmouth Inlet - Installation

subtask.title: Installation of the Starter

l1item.para: Make sure that the packing detail 6( PWC69322) on the (PWC69322)starter shaft is serviceable. Replace the packing detail 6( PWC69322) if required.
Install the (PWC69322)starter as follows:

l2item.para:
Install the (PWC69322)starter on the starter pad adapter detail 2( PWC69322) on the AGB with the
V-band clamp detail 3( PWC69322) . Torque the nut on the V-band clamp 70 lbf.in. (7.9 Nm).

With a soft faced hammer, tap the circumference of the
V-band clamp detail 3( PWC69322) to seat it on the flanges.
Retorque the nut on the V-band clamp 70 lbf.in. (7.9 Nm).

graphic.title: Starter - Installation

subtask.title: Connect the Instrumentation to the Engine

l1item.para: Connect the fuel inlet.
Connect the motive flow.
Connect the AGB static.
Connect the left and right side P3 bleed covers.
Connect the vibration pick ups at plane 1 and plane 3.
Connect the MOP and MOT probe.
Connect the fuel IBI switch.

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

l1item.para: Make sure that the (PWC68891) AGB static pressure tool is correctly installed.
Remove the oil tank filler cap from the oil tank filler neck on the AGB as follows:

l2item.para: Lift the handle on the oil tank filler cap with your hand.
Remove the oil tank filler cap.

l1item.para: Add (PWC03-001) engine oil until the oil level is at the "MAX" mark on the visual oil level indicator.
Install the oil tank filler cap on the oil tank filler neck as follows:

l2item.para: Install the oil tank filler cap.
Lower the handle on the oil tank filler cap with your hand.

graphic.title: Engine Oil System - Fill

l1item.para: Refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-801) for general data and the safety precautions.
Prepare the engine per 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-802).
Install the engine in the test cell per 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-803).

subtask.title: Uncommanded Acceleration or Deceleration

l1item.para: If at any time during an engine test an uncommanded acceleration or deceleration occurs, do the steps that follow:

l2item.para: If the TLA does not respond, push the emergency stop button immediately.
Contact Customer Support.
Do not operate the engine until the cause of the problem and a corrective action plan has been put into place.

subtask.title: Engine Surges

l1item.para: If at any time during an engine test the engine surges, do the steps that follow:

l2item.para: Move the TLA to idle position, and if applicable stop any ARINC schedules that are running.
If the engine does not recover and continues to surge, shutdown the engine immediately.
Contact Customer Support.

subtask.title: MOP Exceeds Limits

l1item.para: If at any time during an engine test there is a loss, sudden drop or fluctuating MOP that exceeds the operational limits, do the steps that follow:

l2item.para: Decelerate to idle immediately.
If the MOP is within operational limits at idle, do a normal shutdown.
If the MOP is not within operational limits at idle, shutdown the engine immediately.
Contact Customer Support.

subtask.title: High ITT (Abort Start)

l1item.para: If during an engine start procedure it appears that the ITT will exceed the operational limits, do the steps that follow:

l2item.para: Shutdown the engine immediately.
Wait until N2 decelerates to zero RPM, then do a 120 second dry motoring cycle to clear out any trapped fuel vapors.
Contact Customer Support.

subtask.title: Engine Fails to Light Up within 20 Seconds of Fuel On (Abort Start)

l1item.para: If during an engine start procedure the engine does not light up within 20 seconds from fuel on, do the steps that follow:

l2item.para: Do a normal shutdown.
Turn the ignition off.
Wait until N2 decelerates to zero RPM.
Do not attempt another start.
Check faults, and record the faults on the log sheet.
Cycle EEC power to clear any latched faults.
Do a dry motoring cycle as required to clear out any trapped fuel vapors.
Do a visual inspection to make sure that there is no fuel accumulated in the bottom of the bypass duct.
Attempt another engine start, and if the engine fails to light again, contact Customer Support.

subtask.title: High Power Shutdown

l1item.para: Determine the cause of the shutdown before you restart the engine.

note.para: A high power shutdown is when the engine is running above flight idle and shuts down on its own.

l1item.para: Do a vibration survey to make sure the vibration levels are within limits.

caution.para: DO NOT START THE ENGINE UNTIL YOU HAVE FAMILIARIZED YOURSELF WITH THE EMERGENCY PROCEDURES OR THE ENGINE MAY BE DAMAGED DURING THE TEST PROCEDURE.

l1item.para: Refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-804) for the emergency procedures.

subtask.title: Engine Start Pre-Settings

l1item.para: Do the smart panel set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set WOW ON GND = ON.
Set GEAR DOWN = ON.
Set EEC IGNITION CONTROL = OFF.
Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = ON.
Set POWER PLANT RIGHT = OFF.
Set AIRCRAFT ID 1 = ON.
Set AIRCRAFT ID 3 = ON.
Set IGNITION (Auto) = (Armed).
Set IGNITION = ON.

l1item.para: Do the PLC set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set IGNITION (1 and 2) = ON.
Set FUEL = ON.
Set STARTER BLOWER = ON.

subtask.title: Engine Start

l1item.para: Set TLA to IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees).
Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = RUN.
On the smart panel, push and hold the START SOL discrete until latched.

note.para: The start must be done within 30 seconds from setting the START SOL discrete.

l1item.para: Set STARTER = ON (PLC).
Make sure that N2 turns.
Make sure that ITT increases and stays within limits, refer to Engine Operating Limits, (Task 72-00-00-700-828).
Make sure that MOP increases.
Set STARTER = OFF (PLC) after idle is achieved (N2 = 21542-21702 RPM).
Make sure that both IGNITIONS = OFF after idle is achieved.

subtask.title: Engine Idle Speed and MOP Check

l1item.para: Make sure that N2 = 21542-21702 RPM.
Make sure that MOP is within operating limits per Figure.
Make sure that TTI and TTL are within limits, refer to Engine Operating Limits, (Task 72-00-00-700-828).
Visually examine the engine for oil, fuel, and air leaks.
Repair any leaks that are found.

subtask.title: Engine to Ground Idle

l1item.para: Set TLA to IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees) and set WOW ON GND = ON.
Set GEARDOWN = ON
Make sure that N2 = 21542-21702 RPM.
Let the engine operation be stable for two minutes.

subtask.title: Engine Shutdown

l1item.para: Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = SHUTDOWN.
Make sure that N1 and N2 rundown times are within the engine operating limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-829), if not, contact Customer Support.
Do an audio check during the engine rundown and make sure that there are no unusual noises.
On the PLC panel do as follows:

l2item.para: Set FUEL = OFF.
Set STARTER BLOWER = OFF.

note.para: The penalty run is to be done after a problem was corrected because a component or system of the engine was unsatisfactory during the initial engine test.
The penalty run can also be done and repeated as required to accumulate the necessary running time on the engine.

l1item.para: Make sure linear TLA = OFF.
Set engine at flight idle, set WOW = OFF.
Let the engine dwell for ten minutes.
Set TLA to detent Max. T.O. position of 69.0 to 73.0 Deg.
Let the engine dwell for two minutes.
Set TLA to MAX climb position of 49.0 to 53.0 Deg.
Let the engine dwell for thirteen (13) minutes.
Set TLA to MAX cruise position of 38.0 to 42.0 Deg.
Let the engine dwell for twenty eight (28) minutes.
Set TLA = 0-4 degrees (FI).
Let the engine dwell for nineteen (19) minutes.

subtask.title: Engine Oil Level Check

l1item.para: Make sure the engine oil tank is filled to the maximum, refer to Testing-00, Filling the Engine Oil System, (Task 72-00-00-610-801).

subtask.title: Installation of the Pre-Test Trims

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE EEC POWER IS OFF.

note.para: The procedure that follows defines how to connect and to initialize the PW617F-E Data Collection Unit in the test cell environment. This procedure is only to be used when the engine is shutdown and the EEC power is off.

l1item.para: Disconnecting the engine EEC harness connector and connect the DCU initialization cable to the DCU.
Select the COM for channel A.

note.para: Initializing the DCU through one channel automatically initializes the other channel.

l1item.para: Select a 'BAUD' rate of 9600 and engine "PW617F_617F0300_V001".
From the DCU menu; select "Live DCU data".

note.para: The adjacent window will appear when the blocks are being read from the DCU.

l1item.para: Input or verify the DCU block data that follows:

numlitem.para: The remaining data does not have to be verified.
"*" - Data is to be manually input. Make sure to use a decimal place.

l2item.para: Block 0

note.para: For the Pre-Test trim, all other block data does not require input or verification.

l1item.para: When data input is complete, select "Write [F5]".

note.para: This will write the values to the DCU. The new numbers will be shown in the value column.

l1item.para: When complete, select "CLOSE" to return to the main screen of the DCU companion.

note.para: The trim values from the "DCU companion" will display four (4) places after the decimal. Make sure these values are equal to the required performance trims, if rounded off to one (1) place after the decimal.

subtask.title: DAS Display Verification of Pre-Test Trims

l1item.para: Disconnect the DCU initialization cable from the DCU and connect the engine EEC harness to the DCU.
Power on the EEC.
Use ARINC or UART display on both channels to verify the following:

l2item.para: N1TRIM = 0.0
ITTTRIM = 1.0

subtask.title: Review the Emergency Procedures

l1item.para: Make sure that you are familiar with the emergency procedures before you start to test the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-804).

subtask.title: TLA Settings

l1item.para: Set IDLE = 0-4.0 degrees.
Set MAX = 69-73 degrees.

subtask.title: AGB Chip Detector Function Check

l1item.para: Power OFF the EEC.
Remove the AGB chip detector.
Short the contact faces with metal.
Power ON the EEC.
Verify the chip detector warning = ON.
Power OFF the EEC.
Remove the short.
Re-install the chip detector.
Power ON the EEC.
Verify no chip detector warning.

subtask.title: Oil Filter Impending Bypass Indicator Check

l1item.para: Make sure that the popup button on the oil filter impending bypass indicator is not tripped.

note.para: When the popup button is tripped a red circle will protrude outside the housing.

subtask.title: Fuel Bypass Switch Check

l1item.para: Make sure that the IBI switch indications in control room are OFF.
Disconnect electrical connector from fuel filter impending bypass switch.
Connect electrical connector to (PWC68454) impending bypass box.
Make sure that you get a PLC warning.
Reconnect electrical connector to fuel filter impending bypass switch.
Reset IBI switch indications to OFF.
Make sure that all instruments operate correctly.
Repair any instrument that does not operate correctly.

subtask.title: Set Panel for Motoring

l1item.para: Make sure that TLA is in IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees).
Do the smart panel set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set WOW on GND = ON.
Set GEAR DOWN = ON.
Set IGNITION (AUTO) = ARMED.
Set IGNITION = ON.
Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = RUN.

l1item.para: Do the PLC set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set IGNITION (1 and 2) = OFF.
Set FUEL = ON.
Set STARTER BLOWER = ON.

note.para: Motoring cycle can be aborted by setting NORMAL SHUTDOWN = RUN to NORMAL SHUTDOWN = SHUTDOWN.

subtask.title: Wet Motoring Cycle

l1item.para: Set TLA to IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees).
On the smart panel, make sure that NORMAL SHUTDOWN = RUN.
On the smart panel, push and hold the START discrete until latched.
Set STARTER = ON.
After 15 seconds and indications are stable, make sure you have fuel pressure.
Make sure you have MOP.

note.para: Visually inspect the engine externals for oil and abnormal fuel leaks, rectify is necessary.

subtask.title: Dry Motoring Cycle

l1item.para: Set TLA to IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees).
Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = SHUTDOWN.
After 15 seconds, make sure that fuel flow = 0.
Set STARTER = OFF.
Make sure that all drain bottles are empty.
Make sure that the oil level is at the MIN. mark on the oil level indicator. If not add oil as required, refer to Testing-00, Filling the Engine Oil System, (Task 72-00-00-610-801).

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: MOP Check

l1item.para: Do the engine start pre-settings, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-007).
Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
Set TLA to TAKE-OFF detent of 59.0 to 63.0 Deg.
Let the engine operation be stable for five minutes.
Record MOP.
Make sure that MOP is within the engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-830), (Ref. Fig. .
If the MOP is not within limits, do the steps that follow (Ref. Fig. :

l2item.para: Set the engine to ground idle, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-010).
Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).
Remove the two nuts, washers, and bolts that attach the flange to the oil pump.
Lift the flange and turn the cover CW to increase or CCW to decrease the oil pressure.

note.para: Each tang equals 3.6 psi (24.8 kPa) of adjustment.

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the two bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil .
Align the slots in the flange with the tangs on the cover and install the flange on the oil pump with the two bolts, washers, and nuts. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Repeat the MOP check procedure to make sure the MOP is within limits.

graphic.title: MOP Adjustment

subtask.title: Initial Oil Datum Check

l1item.para: Let the engine operation be stable for two minutes at ground idle.
Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).

note.para: Before shutdown, make sure the MOT is achievable per Oil Consumption Check (Task 72-00-00-700-020)

l1item.para: When the N2 rotor has stopped, remove the AGB chip detector housing and allow the oil to drain for 5 minutes.
Record the MOT.
Replenish the oil to the "MIN" mark in the visual oil level indicator. If required, drain the oil to the MIN mark.
Re-install the AGB chip detector housing.
Measure and record the amount of oil drained from the AGB. Return the oil drained from the AGB back to engine oil tank.

Do a check of all the drain bottles and drain tubes, and make sure that any leakage is within the engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-829), fuel and oil system acceptance limits. Empty any fluids from the drain bottles and drain tubes.
Do the engine start pre-settings, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-007).
Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
With the engine at ground idle, on the smart panel set LINEAR TLA.
Start vibration recording.
Do a two minute acceleration to first operating limit, and do not exceed the maximum engine operating limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-828).
Stop vibration recording.
Make sure that all instruments operate correctly on the DAS displays.
Repair any instrument that does not operate correctly before performance calibration.
Start vibration recording.
Do a two minute deceleration to ground idle.
Once the engine is at ground idle, stop vibration recording.
Visually examine the engine for oil, fuel, and air leaks.
Repair any leaks that are found.
Make sure that the acceleration and deceleration vibration plots from the engine are within the engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-827), vibration acceptance limits.
If 1EN1 vibration is out of limits, do the LP high speed trim balancing procedure, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-827), and then repeat steps (3) to (14).

task.title: Ground Idle Thrust and Stability Check

l1item.para: With the engine at G.I., on the smart panel set LINEAR TLA.
Set the fuel and humidity parameters that follow in the data reduction program PWC83031:

l2item.para: Relative Humidity (RH).
Lower Heating Value (LHV).

l1item.para: After three minutes, set CALIBRATION = ON in the data reduction program PWC83031.
Take condition.
Process the condition with data reduction program PWC83031.
Do a N2 stability check as follows:

l2item.para: Take a recording of 30 seconds duration of N1 and N2 speeds.
Plot the minimum and maximum peaks for each N1 and N2. The differences between each peak should be within limits for each speed, refer to Task 72-00-00-700-829.

l1item.para: Set WOW = OFF.
Set GEAR UP = OFF.
After three minutes, take condition.
Process the condition with data reduction program PWC83031.
Set FNR2A = 1600 ± 25 LBS.
Make sure the instrumentation spreads are within the Supplementary Limitations per Table . Deletions are allowed per the Table if instrumentation is verified to be faulty.
After three minutes, take condition and process with data reduction program PWC83031.
Set FNR2A = 1695 ± 25 LBS.
After three minutes, take condition and process with data reduction program PWC83031.
Do a take-off N1 and N2 stability check as follows:

l2item.para: Take a recording of 30 seconds duration of N1 and N2 speeds.
Plot the minimum and maximum peaks for each N1 and N2. The differences betrween each peak should be within limits for each speed, refer to Task 72-00-00-700-829.

l1item.para: Set FNR2A = 1800 ± 25 LBS.
After three minutes, take condition and process with data reduction program PWC83031.
Do a normal deceleration to ground idle.
Set CALIBRATION = OFF.
Use the final acceptance option in the data reduction program PWC83031, and generate the final acceptance information sheet.
Make sure that the engine performance stated on the final acceptance information sheet is within the engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-829), performance acceptance limits.
With the engine G.I., do as follows:

l2item.para: Set the WOW on GND = ON
Set GEARDOWN = ON.
On the smart panel, deselect LINEAR TLA.

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

l1item.para: Let the engine operation be stable for two minutes at ground idle.
Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).
When the N2 rotor has stopped, remove the AGB chip detector housing and allow the oil to drain for 5 minutes.
Record MOT. Make sure the MOT is within ± 10 deg. of the value recorded in the Initial Oil Datum Check, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-812), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-022).
Use a syringe to replenish the oil to the "MIN" mark in the visual oil level indicator. Record the amount of oil added.
Re-install the AGB chip detector housing.
Measure and record the amount of oil drained from the AGB. Return the oil drained from the AGB back to the engine oil tank.
Calculate the oil consumption as follows: OC = OA X (0.128/RT).

numlitem.para: OC = Oil Consumption (lb/hr).
OA = Oil Added (cc) + D_AGB (CC).
D_AGB = AGB Drained Delta (I_AGB - F_AGB) (CC)
I_AGB = Qty AGB drained @ Initial (CC)
F_AGB = Qty AGB drained @ Final (CC)
RT = Oil Consumption Run Time (Minutes)

l1item.para: Make sure the oil consumption is within the engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-830), fuel and oil acceptance limits.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE EEC POWER IS OFF.

numlitem.para: This procedure is only to be used when the engine is shutdown.
Get the trim values from the final acceptance report produced by the Data Reduction Program PWC83031.

l1item.para: Disconnect the EEC harness and connect the DCU initialization cable to the DCU.
Select the COM Channel A.

note.para: Initializing the DCU through one channel automatically initializes the other channel.

l1item.para: Select a 'BAUD' rate of 9600 and engine "PW617F_617F0300_V001".
Select from the DCU menu - Live DCU Data.

note.para: The adjacent window will appear when the blocks are being read from the DCU.

l1item.para: Input and verify the DCU block data that follows:

numlitem.para: The remaining block data does need to be inputted.
* - Data manually inputted and should use a decimal point.
R - Data will be for reference purposes only, no input required if faults are recorded. Contact Engineering for further investigation.

l2item.para: BLOCK 0
BLOCK 1
BLOCK 2
BLOCK 5
BLOCK 8

note.para: For Pre-Test trim all other block data does not require input/verification.

l1item.para: When the data input is complete, select "WRITE [F5]".

note.para: This will write the values to the DCU. The new values will be shown in the value column.

l1item.para: When complete, select "CLOSE" to return to the main screen of the DCU companion.

note.para: The trim values from the 'DCU COMPANION' will display four (4) places after the decimal. Make sure these values are equal to the required performance trims, if rounded off to one (1) place after the decimal.

taskproc.title: DAS Display Verification of Final Trims

l1item.para: Disconnect the DCU initialization cable from the DCU and connect the engine harness to the DCU.
Power on the EEC.
Use the ARINC or UART display to make sure the N1 trim and the ITT trim are the values you get from the final acceptance report produced by the Data Reduction Program PWC83031 for both channels.
Print a hard copy of display.
Power off the EEC.
Disconnect the engine harness cable connector from the DCU.
Power on the EEC.

note.para: Do all engine runs with the engine DCU harness disconnected from the DCU.

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

l1item.para: Put a drip tray under the oil filter cover to collect residual oil.

warning.para: THE OIL FILTER HOUSING HAS RESIDUAL OIL WHICH MAY BE HOT. WEAR LONG PROTECTIVE GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION WHEN REMOVING THE OIL FILTER COVER.

l1item.para: Remove the three nuts and washers that attach the oil filter cover to the oil filter housing, and remove the oil filter cover.
Remove the retaining ring that secures the oil filter element in the oil filter cover, and remove the oil filter element.
Do a debris patch test on the oil filter element, and record the condition on the log sheet.
Install a new oil filter element as follows:

l2item.para: Install the new packing in the oil filter element.
Install the new oil filter element in the oil filter housing with the retaining ring.

l1item.para: Install the oil filter cover as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the threads of the three studs on the oil filter housing with (PWC03-001) engine oil.
Make sure that the packing on the oil filter cover is serviceable. Replace the packing if required.
Install the oil filter cover on the oil filter housing with the three washers and nuts.
Torque the three nuts 32 to 36 lbf.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm).

graphic.title: Oil Filter Check

l1item.para: Push on the chip detector and turn it 90 degrees CCW, and remove it from the self-closing valve.
Examine the chip detector for visible debris and record the condition.
Align the locking tabs on the chip detector with the slots on the self-closing valve, and push the chip detector into the self-closing valve and turn it 90 degrees CW to lock it in position.

graphic.title: Chip Detector Check

task.title: Engine Start to Flight Idle Check

l1item.para: Do the smart panel set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set WOW on GND = OFF.
Set GEAR DOWN = OFF.
Set EEC ignition control = OFF.
Set IGNITION (Auto) = ARMED.
Set IGNITION = ON.

l1item.para: Do the PLC set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set IGNITION (1 and 2) = ON.
Set FUEL = ON.
Set STARTER BLOWER = ON.

l1item.para: Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
Verify N2 speed is per Table .

note.para: Flight idle mechanical N2 should be within +/- 0.2% of the software mechanical N2 request.

task.title: Acceleration Time Check and Increase Accel Check

note.para: Make sure the accel procedures is conducted with a trim engine in Customer TLA (Detent MODE).

l1item.para: Once the engine reaches flight idle, set STARTER = OFF.
Set TLA to Max. position of 69.0 to 73.0 Deg. (N1 = 100%) and set MAX. TLA stop at this position.
Set TLA to IDLE position (0-4.0 degrees).
Record TTO parameter from channel A.
Slam accelerate TLA to MAX.
Find the interval between the start of the TLA movement and the point at which N1 achieves 98%.
Compare the time from step (6) with the acceleration tram line, (Ref. Fig. . A pass occurs at or below the tram line for the respective EATTO.
Let the engine operation be stable for one minute.
Do a normal deceleration to flight idle.
Reset the smart panel set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set WOW on GND = ON.
Set GEAR DOWN = ON.

l1item.para: On the test shell monitor:

numlitem.para: open EEC test shell
select +2% increased ACCREF option.
follow the screen prompts for test modes.

l1item.para: Slam accel to MAX. stop, stabilize for 20 seconds.
Slam decel to G.I.

note.para: Engine must not surge (audible surge). If engine surges, contact engineering.

l1item.para: Reset the smart panel set up as follows:

l2item.para: Set WOW on GND = OFF.
Set GEAR DOWN = OFF.
Reset test shell with default options.

graphic.title: Acceleration Tram Line

l1item.para: Visually examine the engine for oil, fuel, and air leaks.
Repair any leaks that are found.
Do a check of all the drain bottles and drain tubes, and make sure that any leakage is within engine test acceptance limits, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-829), fuel and oil system acceptance limits.
Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

note.para: Wait a minimum of five minutes after the last engine shutdown, before you preserve the engine fuel system.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69157)motive flow adapter from the FMU, refer to Testing-02, (Task 72-00-00-700-830).
Remove the primary fuel tube as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the two bolts that attach the primary fuel tube to the FMU.
Cut and remove the safety cable from the coupling nut on the primary fuel tube.
Loosen the coupling nut and remove the primary fuel tube.

l1item.para: Remove the secondary fuel tube as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the two bolts that attach the secondary fuel tube to the FMU.
Cut and remove the safety cable from the coupling nut on the secondary fuel tube.
Loosen the coupling nut and remove the secondary fuel tube.

l1item.para: Install the preservation drain tube on the FMU primary fuel outlet as follows (Ref. Sheet 2):

note.para:
The preservation drain tube is made up of three details,
tube Detail 3( PWC69449) , valve Detail 8( PWC69449) and tube Detail 7( PWC69449) . These parts may be assembled as a complete assembly.

l2item.para:
Make sure that the packing Detail 5( PWC69449) on the tube is serviceable. Replace the
packing Detail 5( PWC69449) if required.

Install the preservation drain tube assembly on the FMU primary fuel outlet with the two
bolts detail 4( PWC69449) .
Torque the two bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Direct the preservation drain tube into a waste container.

l1item.para: Install the preservation drain tube on the FMU secondary fuel outlet as follows:

note.para:
The preservation drain tube is made up of three details,
tube Detail 3( PWC69449) , valve Detail 8( PWC69449) and tube Detail 7( PWC69449) . These parts may be assembled as a complete assembly.

l2item.para:
Make sure that the packing Detail 6( PWC69449) on the preservation drain tube is serviceable. Replace the
packing Detail 6( PWC69449) , if required.

Install the preservation drain tube assembly on the FMU secondary fuel outlet with the two
bolts Detail 4( PWC69449) .
Torque the two bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Direct the preservation drain tube into a waste container.

l1item.para: Install the preservation drain tube Detail 13( PWC69449) on the motive flow connector of the FMU, and direct the tube into a waste container.
Connect the preservation oil supply line from the preservation rig to the fuel inlet connector of the FMU.
Turn on the preservation rig.

note.para: Supply preservation fluid to the engine at a minimum pressure of 5 to 25 psig (34.5-172.3 KPag) and a maximum temperature of 60°F (15°C).

l1item.para: Do a motoring cycle as follows:

l2item.para: Set IGNITION = OFF.
Set IGNITION (AUTO) = ON.
Set STARTER BLOWER = ON.
Set WOW on GND = ON.
Set NORMAL SHUTDOWN = RUN.
Set TLA = IDLE DETENT (0-4.0 degrees).
On the smart panel, push and hold the START SOL discrete until latched.
Set STARTER = ON.

Once (PWC05-077) preservative oil flows from the preservation drain tubes on the FMU primary and secondary fuel outlets, close the shut-off valves and continue motoring for up to 30 seconds or until preservative oil flows from the preservation drain tube on the motive flow connector of the FMU.

l1item.para: Turn off the preservation rig.
Disconnect the preservation oil supply line from the fuel inlet connector of the FMU.
Install a cap on the fuel inlet connector of the FMU.
Disconnect and remove the preservation drain tube Detail 13( PWC69449) from the motive flow connector of the FMU.
Install a cap on the motive flow connector of the FMU.
Remove the two bolts Detail 4( PWC69449) that attach the preservation drain tube assembly to the secondary fuel outlet of the FMU, and remove the preservation drain tube assembly.

note.para:
The preservation drain tube assembly is made up of three details, tube Detail 3( PWC69449) ,
valve Detail 8( PWC69449) and tube Detail 7( PWC69449) . Keep these parts as a complete assembly.

l1item.para: Remove the two bolts Detail 4( PWC69449) that attach the preservation drain tube assembly to the primary fuel outlet of the FMU, and remove the preservation drain tube assembly.

note.para:
The preservation drain tube assembly is made up of three details, tube Detail 3( PWC69449) ,
valve Detail 8( PWC69449) and tube Detail 7( PWC69449) . Keep these parts as a complete assembly.

l1item.para: Install the secondary fuel tube as follows (Ref. Sheet 1):

l2item.para: Lubricate the coupling nut and bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil .
Install the secondary fuel tube with the coupling nut and two bolts.
Torque the coupling nut 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.8 Nm) and the two bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm).

l1item.para: Install the primary fuel tube as follows:

l2item.para: Lubricate the coupling nut and bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil .
Install the primary fuel tube with the coupling nut and two bolts.
Torque the coupling nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.1-11.2 Nm) and the two bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm).

l1item.para: Complete and sign the preservation tag.

graphic.title: Fuel System Preservation

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: LP High Speed Trim Balancing

l1item.para: Get the peak RPM from the PL1 vibration survey.

note.para: This speed will be used as the nominal for this procedure.

l1item.para: Connect the viper analyzer as follows:

l2item.para: Connect the viper power cable to the test cell control room outlet and the battery cable to the viper analyzer.
Connect the velocity meter and tach signal outputs from the power cable to the viper analyzer.

note.para: The viper analyzer should automatically turn on.

l2item.para: On the viper analyzer MAIN menu, select MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS and press ENTER.
On the MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS menu, select CHECK BATTERY and make sure that the battery charge indication is not less than 50%.

note.para: If the battery charge indication is less than 50%, charge the battery before you proceed.

l2item.para: Press the backup key twice to return to the MAIN menu, but do not press the MAIN menu key.

l1item.para: Set up the viper analyzer as follows:

l2item.para: On the viper analyzer MAIN menu, select FAN/TURBINE BALANCE using the UP and DOWN curser keys and press ENTER.
Select START A JOB using the UP and DOWN curser keys and press ENTER.

note.para: The window will prompt to incomplete job last job performed is incomplete. Finish it?

l2item.para: Select NO by pressing the F5 key.
At SELECT SET UP LIST, choose the required engine model and balancing using the UP and DOWN curser keys and press ENTER.
At JOB IDENTIFICATION do as follows:

note.para: When you use the alphanumeric keypad the first character is inserted by a single press, the second character is inserted by two rapid presses, and the third character by three rapid presses and so on.

l3item.para: Enter the AIRCRAFT NAME xxxxxx (engine serial number).
For A/C REGISTRATION, leave it blank.
For A/C TOTAL TIME, leave it blank.
Press ENTER.

l2item.para: At the ENGINE INFORMATION menu, select POSITION 1, and using the UP and DOWN curser keys enter the engine serial number.
Ignore the fields that follow:

l3item.para: TYPE.
TSN.
CYC.

l2item.para: Press ENTER.
At the LABEL DETAIL WEIGHT HOLES press ENTER.
At the DEFINE FAN/TURBINE BALANCE RPM menu do as follows:

l3item.para: Use the LEFT and RIGHT cursor keys to select 5 for the NUMBER OF BAL SPEEDS.
Use the UP and DOWN curser keys and move to ENTERED RPM RELATIVE TO PEAK.
Select YES using the LEFT and RIGHT cursor keys.
Use the UP and DOWN curser keys and move to PEAK SPEED and enter the peak N1 speed acquired from the vibration survey 1EN1 plot.
Use the key pad and enter the five speeds relative to peak.
Press ENTER.

l1item.para: Do the engine start pre-settings, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-007).
Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
Do the engine idle speed and MOP check, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-009).
Make sure that MOT is 125°F (51°C) minimum before you take points on the viper analyzer.

note.para: The viper analyzer will display the current RPM value.

l1item.para: Press ENTER.

Bring the engine to the required N1 speeds. Let the engine operation be stable for 10 to 15 seconds at each setting to allow the phase and amplitude to stabilize, and then press ENTER to accept each of the five speed points that follow:

l2item.para: Speed 1 = Peak N1 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 2 = Peak N1 RPM − 250 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 3 = Peak N1 RPM − 500 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 4 = Peak N1 RPM − 750 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 5 = Peak N1 RPM − 1000 RPM, then press ENTER.

note.para: At each speed, make sure that the engine RPM is the same as the speed requested by the viper analyzer and that the phase measurement is stable.

l1item.para: At REVIEW PRIOR RUN DISPLAY, press ENTER.
At SHUT-DOWN ENGINE DISPLAY, press the F5 key to continue.
Set the engine to ground idle, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-010).
Activate the dwell timer as follows:

l2item.para: Set VI DWELL 120 seconds.
Take a limited set of readings.

l1item.para: Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).
Remove the bellmouth inlet, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-02, (Task 72-00-00-700-830), (Subtask 72-00-00-080-005).
Remove the inlet cone, refer to (Subtask 72-00-00-080-002).
Install the trial counterweight set-screws as follows:

note.para: The viper analyzer calculates solutions.

l2item.para: Select counterweight set-screws from Table .

Install the counterweight set-screws closest to the trial solution defined by the viper analyzer at the indicated inlet cone balance trim locations. Do not exceed 20 lbf.in. (2.2 Nm). A counterweight set-screw can be reused providing it has a positive indication of breakaway torque. Make sure that the counterweight set-screw is flush with or below Face E (Ref. Fig. .

note.para: A maximum of nine counterweight set-screws can be used, (Ref. F & C No. 1802).

l2item.para: Use the view on the rear face of the inlet cone and record the counterweight set-screw class number and its hole position, in a CW direction from the No. 1 mark.

l1item.para: Record the class of the trial counterweight set-screws and their positions into the viper analyzer. Use the LEFT and RIGHT cursor key for class selection and UP and DOWN curser keys to go from hole to hole. Press ENTER.
Install the inlet cone, refer to (Subtask 72-00-00-480-026).
Install the bellmouth inlet, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-803), (Subtask 72-00-00-480-024).
Do the engine start pre-settings, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-007).
Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
Do the engine idle speed and MOP check, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-009).

note.para: Do not turn off IGNITION OFF on the PLC while the engine is running.

l1item.para: Make sure that MOT is 125°F (51°C) minimum before you take points on the viper analyzer.

note.para: The viper analyzer will display the current RPM value.

l1item.para: Bring the engine to the required N1 speeds. Let the engine operation be stable for 10 to 15 seconds at each setting to allow the phase and amplitude to stabilize, and then press ENTER to accept each of the five speed points that follow:

l2item.para: Speed 1 = Peak N1 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 2 = Peak N1 RPM − 250 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 3 = Peak N1 RPM − 500 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 4 = Peak N1 RPM − 750 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 5 = Peak N1 RPM − 1000 RPM, then press ENTER.

note.para: At each speed, make sure that the engine RPM is the same as the speed requested by the viper analyzer and that the phase measurement is stable.

l1item.para: Calculate the required trim weights and their angular positions using the viper analyzer and use the best solution indicated.

note.para: All engine runs related to trim balancing must be performed consecutively.

l1item.para: Set the engine to ground idle, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-010).
Activate the dwell timer as follows:

l2item.para: Set VI DWELL 120 seconds.
Take a limited set of readings.

l1item.para: Shutdown the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-806), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-011).
Remove the bellmouth inlet, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-02, (Task 72-00-00-700-830), (Subtask 72-00-00-080-005).
Remove the inlet cone, refer to (Subtask 72-00-00-080-002).
Remove the trial counterweights set-screws and install the trim counterweight set-screws as recommended by the viper analyzer. Use the best solution indicated by the viper analyzer.

note.para: The viper analyzer calculates final or successive solutions based on previous trial counterweight set-screws having been removed. Only remove the affected counterweight set-screws from the inlet cone.

l1item.para: Enter the available locations recorded and the viper analyzer will display a correction at the available locations.
Select counterweight set-screws from Table .

Install the counterweight set-screws closest to the solution defined by the viper analyzer at the indicated inlet cone balance trim locations. Do not exceed 20 lbf.in. (2.2 Nm). A counterweight set-screw can be reused providing it has a positive indication of breakaway torque. Make sure that the counterweight set-screw is flush with or below Face E (Ref. Fig. .

Enter the position and class of the solution counterweight set-screws into the viper analyzer. Use the LEFT and RIGHT cursor key for class selection and UP and DOWN curser keys to go from hole to hole. Press Enter.
Use the view on the rear face of the inlet cone and record the counterweight set-screw class number and its hole position, in a CW direction from No. 1 mark.
Install the inlet cone, refer to (Subtask 72-00-00-480-026).
Install the bellmouth inlet, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-803), (Subtask 72-00-00-480-024).
Do the engine start pre-settings, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-007).
Start the engine, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-008).
Do the engine idle speed and MOP check, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-805), (Subtask 72-00-00-760-009).

note.para: Do not turn off IGNITION OFF on the PLC while the engine is running.

l1item.para: Make sure that MOT is 125°F (51°C) minimum before you take points on the viper analyzer.

note.para: The viper analyzer will display the current RPM value.

l1item.para: Repeat the engine run at the identical five dwell points. Bring the engine to the required N1 speeds. Let the engine operation be stable for 10 to 15 seconds at each setting to allow the phase and amplitude to stabilize, and then press ENTER to accept each of the five speed points that follow:

l2item.para: Speed 1 = Peak N1 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 2 = Peak N1 RPM − 250 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 3 = Peak N1 RPM − 500 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 4 = Peak N1 RPM − 750 RPM, then press ENTER.
Speed 5 = Peak N1 RPM − 1000 RPM, then press ENTER.

numlitem.para: At each speed, make sure that the engine RPM is the same as the speed requested by the viper analyzer and that the phase measurement is stable.
All engine runs related to trim balancing must be performed consecutively.
This engine run can also be used as a further trial run if the result is not acceptable.

l1item.para: On the REVIEW PRIOR RUNS DATA make sure that vibration results are lower than 0.60 in./sec. avg on the five speeds.
If the engine run is acceptable do the vibration survey, refer to (Task 72-00-00-700-813).

graphic.title: Trim Balance Counterweight Configuration

subtask.title: Removal of the Inlet Cone

l1item.para: With the (PWC68935)special socket, remove the three bolts and washers that attach the inlet cone to the fan and remove the inlet cone.

graphic.title: Inlet Cone - Removal

subtask.title: Installation of the Inlet Cone

l1item.para: Lubricate the threads of the three bolts with ( PWC03-001)engine oil.

Align the 1 mark on the inlet cone with the X mark on the balance plate, and install the inlet cone on the fan with the three washers and bolts using the (PWC68935) special socket. Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: Before you install the inlet cone, make sure there is no foreign material inside the fan hub or inlet cone.

graphic.title: Inlet Cone - Installation

l1item.para: See the references that follow to find the applicable engine operating limits:

l2item.para: Table gives the Engine Start Limits.
Table gives the Engine Shutdown Limits.
Table gives the Engine Main Operating Limits.
Table gives the Engine Supplementary Limits.

not to exceed one per rake and
not to exceed one per rake and
not to exceed one per rake and

MOP Limits

l1item.para: See the references that follow to find the applicable engine test acceptance limits:

Table gives the Performance Acceptance Limits.
Table gives the Repair Limits in relation to Time Since Overhaul.
Table gives the Steady State Stability Acceptance Limits.
Table gives the Fuel and Oil System Acceptance Limits.
Table gives the Control System Acceptance Limits.

Fuel and Oil System Acceptance Limits

entry.para: Maximum Oil Leakage (AGB Starter Pad Drain)

numlitem.para: Minor leakage (weepage) from the Bleed Valve Actuator Fuel Drain of 0 to 0.2 cc/hr is acceptable during test.

Oil Consumption (OC) is to be calculated as follows:OC = OA * (0.128/RT)OA = Oil added + D_AGB (cc)D_AGB = AGB Drain delta (I_AGB - F_AGB) (cc)I_AGB = Qty AGB Drain @ Initial (cc)F_AGB = Qty AGB Drain @ Final (cc)RT = Oil Consumption Runtime (minutes)
MOT for oil consumption calculation is to be +/- 5°F of MOT recorded at initial oil datum check.

Penalty Run: Penalty test are for all engines that have failed the acceptable Pass-Off oil consumption check. The following Table Field Representative Mission Profile is required for the oil consumption check. Do the profile twice for a total actual run time of 144 minutes. Effective run-time for the oil consumption calculation is2 X 103 = 206 minutes

graphic.title: MOP vs MOT Requirements at Take Off Thrust

l1item.para: Remove the engine from the test cell per 72-00-00, Testing-02, (Task 72-00-00-700-830).

task.title: Remove the Engine from the Test Cell

l1item.para: Refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-801) for general data and the safety precautions.

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Disconnect the Instrumentation from the Engine

l1item.para: Disconnect the fuel IBI switch.
Disconnect the MOP and MOT probes.
Disconnect the vibration pick ups at plane 1 and plane 3.
Disconnect the left and right side P3 bleed covers.
Disconnect the AGB static.
Disconnect the motive flow.
Disconnect the fuel inlet.

subtask.title: Removal of the Starter

l1item.para:
Loosen the nut on the V-band clamp detail 3( PWC69322) and remove the
V-band clamp detail 3( PWC69322) and (PWC69322) starter from the starter pad adapter detail 2( PWC69322) on the AGB.

graphic.title: Starter - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Bellmouth Inlet

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the four ball lock pins detail 13( PWC69142) from the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct and (PWC69142)bellmouth inlet.
Loosen the nut on the (PWC69156) V-band clamp, and remove the (PWC69156)V-band clamp and ( PWC69142)bellmouth inlet from the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct.

graphic.title: Bellmouth Inlet - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Bellmouth Transition Duct

l1item.para: Press on the clamp and remove the T1 sensor from the hole on the (PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct, then release the clamp.

Remove the 14 slave nuts (P/N ST3030-10), slave bolts (P/N MS9557-12), and slave washers (P/N MS9321-10) that attach the ( PWC69143)bellmouth transition duct to the fan case, and remove the (PWC69143) bellmouth transition duct.

graphic.title: Bellmouth Transition Duct - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the −5% Exhaust Nozzle

l1item.para: Remove the 16 nuts detail 4( PWC69144) , washers detail 3( PWC69144) , and bolts detail 2( PWC69144) that attach the (PWC69463) −5% exhaust nozzle to the (PWC69144)instrument duct, and remove the (PWC69463)−5% exhaust nozzle.

graphic.title: Exhaust Nozzle - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the P6 and T6 Rakes and Plugs from the Instrument Duct

l1item.para:
Remove the 16 bolts detail 7( PWC69144) and
washers detail 3( PWC69144) that attach the four (PWC69149) T6 rakes to the (PWC69144) instrument duct, and remove the four ( PWC69149)T6 rakes and ( PWC62832)gaskets.

Remove the 12 bolts detail 7( PWC69144) and
washers detail 3( PWC69144) that attach the three (PWC69153) P6 rakes to the (PWC69144) instrument duct, and remove the three ( PWC69153)P6 rakes and ( PWC62832)gaskets.

Remove the 16 bolts detail 7( PWC69144) and
washers detail 3( PWC69144) that attach the four (PWC69213) P6/T6 rake plugs to the (PWC69144)instrument duct, and remove the four (PWC69213)P6/T6 rake plugs and (PWC62832) gaskets.

graphic.title: P6 and T6 Rakes and Plugs from the Instrument Duct - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the P15/T15 Rakes and Plugs from the Instrument Duct

l1item.para:
Remove the 16 bolts detail 7( PWC69144) and
washers detail 3( PWC69144) that attach the four (PWC69152) P15/T15 rakes to the (PWC69144) instrument duct, and remove the four ( PWC69152)P15/T15 rakes and (PWC62833)gaskets .

Remove the 16 bolts detail 7( PWC69144) and
washers detail 3( PWC69144) that attach the four (PWC69212) P15/T15 rake plugs to the (PWC69144)instrument duct, and remove the four (PWC69212)P15/T15 rake plugs and (PWC62833) gaskets.

graphic.title: P15/T15 Rakes and Plugs from the Instrument Duct - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Engine from the Rear Mount Assembly

l1item.para: Remove the engine mount assembly from the rear mount assembly (P/N LM-471-SA4) as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the two safety pins (P/N 142-153) from the castle nuts (P/N AN310C4) and bolts (P/N NAS6204-11).
Remove the two castle nuts (P/N AN310C4), washers (P/N MS9321-11), bolts (P/N NAS6204-11), and washers (P/N MS9321-11).

graphic.title: Engine from the Rear Mount Assembly - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Instrument Duct

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69594)exhaust protector on the exhaust cone.
Remove the nine bolts detail 7( PWC69144) from the bottom of the (PWC69144)instrument duct .

Remove the 14 nuts detail 4( PWC69144) and
bolts detail 2( PWC69144) that attach the engine mount bracket to the bypass duct, and remove the engine mount bracket.

Remove the 21 nuts detail 4( PWC69144) , washers detail 3( PWC69144) , and bolts detail 2( PWC69144) that attach the (PWC69144) instrument duct to the bypass duct, and remove the (PWC69144)instrument duct.
Remove the (PWC69594)exhaust protector from the exhaust cone.

graphic.title: Instrument Duct - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Vibration Bracket (Plane 1)

l1item.para:
Remove the one short bolt detail 7( PWC69161) and
washer detail 5( PWC69161) , and the two nuts detail 6( PWC69161) , long
bolts detail 4( PWC69161) , and three washers detail 5( PWC69161) that attach the ( PWC69161)vibration bracket and harness bracket to the fan case, and remove the (PWC69161)vibration bracket.

Lubricate the threads of the two long
bolts detail 4( PWC69161) with (PWC03-001) engine oil.

Lubricate the threads of the short
bolt detail 7( PWC69161) with (PWC06-004) antiseize compound.
Install the harness bracket and front lifting bracket on the fan case with the three bolts and two nuts. Torque the two nuts and the short bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Vibration Bracket (Plane 1) - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Engine from the Front Mount Yoke

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69262)lifting sling on the engine, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-803), (Subtask 72-00-00-480-015).
Attach the (PWC69262)lifting sling to a suitable lifting device, and support the weight of the engine.
Remove the two (PWC69289) front mounts from the (PWC69173) front mount yoke as follows:

l2item.para: Remove the two safety pins detail 12( PWC69173) from the bolts detail 9( PWC69173) and castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) .

Remove the two castle nuts detail 13( PWC69173) , washers detail 8( PWC69173) ,
bolts detail 9( PWC69173) , and
washers detail 8( PWC69173) that attach the ( PWC69289)front mounts in the (PWC69173)front mount yoke .

l1item.para: Remove the engine from the test cell and install it on an engine stand.
Remove the (PWC69262)lifting sling from the engine, refer to 72-00-00, Testing-00, (Task 72-00-00-700-803), (Subtask 72-00-00-080-001).

graphic.title: Engine from the Front Mount Yoke - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the MOP and MOT Probe

l1item.para: Remove the two slave nuts (P/N ST3030-09) that attach the (PWC69175)MOT and MOP probe to the AGB, and remove the (PWC69175) MOT and MOP probe.

graphic.title: MOP and MOT Probes - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Spacer Tube

l1item.para: Loosen the two bolts that attach the fuel tube to the FMU.
Loosen the coupling nuts on the fuel tubes, and remove the (PWC69482)spacer tube .
Torque the two bolts that attach the fuel tube to the FMU 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Spacer Tube - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Starter Pad Adapter

l1item.para:
Remove the four nuts detail 4( PWC69322) and 16
washers detail 5( PWC69322) that attach the starter pad adapter detail 2( PWC69322) to the starter pad of the AGB, and remove the
starter pad adapter detail 2( PWC69322) .

graphic.title: Starter Pad Adapter - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the AGB Static Pressure Tool

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC68891)AGB static pressure tool from the AGB.
Make sure that the packing on the drain plug is serviceable. Replace the packing if required.
Install the drain plug on the AGB. Torque the drain plug 40 to 50 lbf.in. (4.5-5.6 Nm).

graphic.title: AGB Static Pressure Tool - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Engine Front Mounts

l1item.para: Remove the four slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) and slave washers (P/N MS35338-45) that attach the (PWC69289) front mount to the upper mount pad, and remove the (PWC69289)front mount .
Remove the four slave bolts (P/N MS9698-08) and slave washers (P/N MS35338-45) that attach the (PWC69289) front mount to the lower mount pad, and remove the (PWC69289)front mount .

graphic.title: Engine Front Mounts - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Fuel Inlet and Motive Flow Adapters

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69157)motive flow adapter from the motive flow fitting of the FMU.
Remove the (PWC68782)fuel inlet adapter from the fuel inlet fitting of the FMU.

graphic.title: Fuel Inlet and Motive Flow Adapters - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the P3 Bleed Covers

l1item.para: Remove the clamp detail 3( PWC69327) that attaches the ( PWC69327)P3 bleed cover to the oil and bleed air fairing.
Remove the (PWC69327)P3 bleed cover and U-ring seal detail 4( PWC69327) from the oil and bleed air fairing.

note.para: Repeat steps (1) and (2) on the opposite side of the engine.

graphic.title: P3 Bleed Covers - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Velocity Transducer (Plane 3)

l1item.para: Remove the slave bolt (P/N MS9556-08) and slave washer (P/N MS9321-09) that attach the (PWC69299) slave bung plug to the bypass duct service fairing, and remove the (PWC69299)slave bung plug.
With the (PWC68764)transducer socket, remove the P/N CEC-4-130-0128velocity transducer from the transducer vibration bracket.

graphic.title: Velocity Transducer - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Drain Bottle from the Bleed Valve Actuator

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC66133)drain bottle from the drain fitting on the bleed valve actuator.

graphic.title: Drain Bottle from the Bleed Valve Actuator - Removal

subtask.title: Removal of the Drain Bottles

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC66133) drain bottle from the overboard drain elbow fitting of the AGB.
Remove the (PWC66133)drain bottle from the overboard drain fitting of the FMU.
Remove the (PWC66133)drain bottle from the gas generator drain fitting.

graphic.title: Drain Bottles - Removal

l1item.para: Send the engine assembly to the shipping department.

Starter Pad Adapter - Removal
AGB Static Pressure Tool - Removal
