Fuel Inlet and Motive Flow Adapters - Removal
P3 Bleed Covers - Removal
Velocity Transducer - Removal
Drain Bottle from the Bleed Valve Actuator - Removal
Drain Bottles - Removal

task.title: Installation of the Engine Components (Right-side Assembler)

l1item.para: Refer to the general installation procedures per 72-00-00, Installation-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-801).
Refer to Inspection/Check-00 (Task 72-00-00-220-801) for the fits and clearances numbers given in this procedure.
Refer to 72-00-00 Assembly-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-802) flowcharts for the sequence of tasks to follow for the complete assembly of the engine.
Assemble the HP Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly per 72-34-01 Assembly-03 (Task 72-34-01-440-803)..

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Preparation of the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly

l1item.para: Turn the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly nosedown.

Install the (PWC68982)rear support on the diffuser case. Secure with three
hand knobs Detail 2( PWC68982) .
Install the (PWC68983)adapter on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly.
Install the (PWC69004)holder on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly with the top dead center (TDC) align with the dowel pin.
Install the (PWC68332)lifter until it contacts the (PWC69004) holder.
Install the (PWC61065-14) rod on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly.
Use a hoist and lift the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly.
Lubricate the packing723402RP03021 with (PWC06-013)assembly fluid. Install the packing in the groove of the compressor stator.
Install the (PWC64241-19) guide pin in the threaded hole as shown.
Attach the (PWC68710)guide at the end of the bleed valve linkage interconnect rod.

graphic.title: Preparation of the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly

subtask.title: Installation of the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE SPIRAL BEVEL GEAR ENGAGE CORRECTLY WITH THE SPIRAL BEVEL GEARSHAFT.

l1item.para: Slowly lower the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly into the compressor case.
Make sure to align the (PWC64241-19) guide pin in the No.3 bearing.
Make sure to align the diffuser case dowel pin with the compressor case flange.
Make sure to align the bleed valve linkage interconnect rod with the hole in the compressor case.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the two bolts724150ab20012 180 degrees apart, on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly. Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Remove hoist from the compressor rotor.
Turn the engine to the horizontal position.

graphic.title: Installation of the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly

subtask.title: Attach the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly Rear Side ( )

l1item.para: Remove the three (PWC64241-2) guide pins, (PWC68332) lifter, (PWC68982) rear support, (PWC68983) adapter and (PWC69004) holder from the diffuser case.

note.para: Do not remove the holder until the assembler on the left has installed the (PWC69006)locking tool.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69593)protector in the compressor case.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the sixteen (16) bolts724150ab200116 on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly rear side. Torque in a star pattern the eighteen (18) bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

numlitem.para: Do not install three bolts at the jacking pad locations on the diffuser case flange.
Two bolts previously installed in Subtask 72-00-01-430-002, step (5).

graphic.title: Attach the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly Rear Side ( )

subtask.title: Attach the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly Rear Side ( )

l1item.para: Remove the three (PWC64241-2) guide pins, (PWC68332) lifter, (PWC68982) rear support, (PWC68983) adapter and (PWC69004) holder from the diffuser case.

note.para: Do not remove the holder until the assembler on the left has installed the (PWC69006)locking tool.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69593)protector in the compressor case.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the fifteen (15) bolts724150ab200116 on the HP compressor rotor balancing assembly rear side. Torque in a star pattern the seventeen (17) bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

numlitem.para: Do not install three bolts at the jacking pad locations on the diffuser case flange and one bolt at the location shown.
Two bolts previously installed in Subtask 72-00-01-430-002, step (5).

graphic.title: Attach the High Pressure Compressor Rotor Balancing Assembly Rear Side ( )

subtask.title: Preparation of the Turbine Support Case for Offset Calculation

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE MATING FACES OF TOOL AND PART ARE CLEAN AND FREE FROM ANY BURRS OR RAISED MATERIAL.

l1item.para: Turn the engine to a vertical position. Install the ( PWC69017)funnel on the compressor case and use two heat guns to heat the compressor case flange for five minutes.
Turn the engine to the horizontal position and align the jacking screw holes and install the (PWC68995) constraining ring on the compressor case.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the six bolts detail 2( PWC68995) in a star pattern. Torque the six bolts in a star pattern 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE MATING FACES OF TOOL AND PART ARE CLEAN AND FREE FROM ANY BURRS OR RAISED MATERIAL.

l1item.para: Slowly install the (PWC69005)runout gage or (PWC69260) runout gage and tighten.

Make sure the sleeve detail 2( PWC69005) or
sleeve detail 2( PWC69260) is installed correctly on the seal runner and tighten.
Turn the engine to a 30 degree angle with the accessory gearbox spigot at BDC.

Put the dial indicator detail 5( PWC69005) or
dial indicator detail 4( PWC69260) on the runout gage at zero (TDC).

numlitem.para: Turn the gage by turning the AGB pinion gearshaft. Examine the runout only on the controlled diameter.
Turn gage around carefully in a clockwise direction a few times to make sure that indicator always reads zero (TDC).

l1item.para: Measure and record runout at locations A, B, C, D.

graphic.title: Preparation of the Turbine Support Case Offset Calculation

subtask.title: Calculation of the Turbine Support Case Offset

l1item.para:
Calculate the turbine support case offset using the following equations:X OFFSET =
(D - B)
2
Y OFFSET =
(C)
2

l2item.para:
And if C is -0.003 in.: Y OFFSET =
-0.003
2
= -0.0015 in.

note.para: Offset values of ± 0.0004 in. or less are considered zero.

l1item.para: Record X and Y offset values.
Remove the (PWC69005)runout gage or (PWC69260) runout gage and (PWC68995) constraining ring.

note.para: For grinding of the turbine support case, refer to 72-51-01 Assembly-02 (Task 72-51-01-320-801).

graphic.title: Calculation of the Turbine Support Case Offset

subtask.title: Installation of the Clamps on the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube ( )

l1item.para: Install the bracket724150AB40011 on the (PWC47011) fixture , short end on fixture, with a slave bolt (MS9208-12 or equivalent). Tighten the bolt with your hand.
Install the clamp792131RC07111 on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube792131PT17011 .
Install the clamp792131DC07011 on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube792131PT17011 .
Install the tube assembly on the (PWC47011) fixture.
Install the (PWC69654)holder on the tube assembly.
Attach the clamp792131RC07111 to the bracket724150AB40011 with the bolt792131AB20111 and nut792131AN05111 . Torque the bolt, 36 to 40 lbf.in (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Remove the slave bolt, (PWC69654) holder and remove the tube assembly from the (PWC47011)fixture.

graphic.title: Installation of the Clamps on the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube ( )

subtask.title:
Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube (
)

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69654)holder on the compressor case. Tighten with your hand.
Use the (PWC69264)holder to install the strainer792131DS51011 in the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.
Lubricate the packing792131rp03021 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.
Lubricate the packing792131rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.

Install the spring waves724193ps44012 on the diffuser exit ducts. Install the No.6 and No.7 diffuser exit ducts724156pd07012 on the HP diffuser case. Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and install the bolts724156ab20012 . Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the spring wave724193ps44011 on the diffuser exit duct. Install the No.5 diffuser exit duct724156pd07011 on the HP diffuser case.
Lubricate the packings with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two packings792131rp03032 on the transfer tube. Install the transfer tube792131pt17031 on the HP diffuser case.
Install the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube792131pt17011 and the gasket792131rg03011 in the compressor case.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the two bolts792131ab20012 on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp792131dc07011 on the tube. Install the bolt724156ab20011 through the clamp and the diffuser exit duct flange. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and torque the bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque the two bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.3 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69654)holder from the compressor case.

graphic.title:
Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube (
)

subtask.title:
Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube (
)

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69654)holder on the compressor case. Tighten with your hand.
Use the (PWC69264)holder to install the strainer792131DS51011 in the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.
Lubricate the packing792131rp03021 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.
Lubricate the packing792131rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube.

Install the spring waves724193ps44012 on the diffuser exit ducts. Install the No.6 and No.7 diffuser exit ducts724156pd07012 on the HP diffuser case. Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and install the bolts724156ab20012 . Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the spring wave724193ps44011 on the diffuser exit duct. Install the No.5 diffuser exit duct724156pd07011 on the HP diffuser case.
Lubricate the packings with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two packings792131rp03032 on the transfer tube. Install the transfer tube792131pt17031 on the HP diffuser case.
Install the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube792131pt17011 and the gasket792131rg03011 in the compressor case.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the two bolts792131ab20012 on the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp792131dc07011 on the tube. Install the bolt724156ab20011 through the clamp and the diffuser exit duct flange. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and torque the bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bolt724150AB20111 to attach the bracket assembly to the diffuser exit duct flange. Torque the bolt, 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque the two bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.3 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69654)holder from the compressor case.

graphic.title:
Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube (
)

subtask.title: Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Scavenge Tube

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69654)holder on the compressor case. Tighten with your hand.
Lubricate the packing792231rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil scavenge tube.
Lubricate the packing792231rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install it on the No.4 bearing oil scavenge tube.
Install the spring wave724193ps44011 on the diffuser exit duct.

Install the No.14 diffuser exit duct724156pd07011 on the HP diffuser case. Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and install the bolt724156ab20011 . Torque the bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the No.4 bearing oil scavenge tube792231pt17011 and the gasket792231rg03011 in the compressor case.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the two bolts792231ab20012 on the No.4 bearing oil scavenge tube. Torque the bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.3 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69654)holder from the compressor case.

graphic.title: Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Scavenge Tube

subtask.title: Installation of the Diffuser Exit Ducts

l1item.para: Insert the seventeen (17) spring waves724193ps440117 on the diffuser exit ducts.

Install the seventeen (17) diffuser exit ducts724156pd070117 on the HP diffuser case. Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Use the (PWC90186)blade ratchet and install the bolts724156ab200117 . Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: Make sure that all the diffuser exit ducts outlets are installed equally. Use the (PWC68689)blade ratchet and loosen the bolts and position the diffuser exit ducts if necessary.

l1item.para: Use a feeler gage and make sure there is 0.060 in. (1.52 mm) minimum gap between the oil tubes and the diffuser exit ducts. If 0.060 in. (1.52 mm) feeler gage can not pass, proceed as follows:

l2item.para: Install the (PWC69654)holder on the compressor case.
Loosen the bolts on the tube.
Position the tube to get the minimum gap by adjusting the (PWC69654)holder.
Torque the bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.3 Nm). Remove the holder.

graphic.title: Installation of the Diffuser Exit Ducts

l1item.para: Continue to assemble engine components per 72-00-01, Installation-02 (Task 72-00-01-430-802).

task.title: Installation of the Engine Components (Right-side Assembler)

l1item.para: Refer to the general installation procedures per 72-00-00, Installation-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-801).
Refer to Inspection/Check-00 (Task 72-00-00-220-801) for the fits and clearances numbers given in this procedure.
Refer to 72-00-00 Assembly-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-802) flowcharts for the sequence of tasks to follow for the complete assembly of the engine.
Install the Engine Components per 72-00-01, Installation-01 (Task 72-00-01-430-801).

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Installation of the Combustion Chamber Liner

l1item.para: Install the two (PWC64241-1) guide pins in the HP diffuser case 180 degrees apart with one installed in the offset hole.
Align the offset hole of the combustion chamber liner flange with the HP diffuser case. Install the combustion chamber liner724276pl05011 in the compressor case.

Lubricate the threads of the combustion liner tube support with (PWC06-036) lubricating compound. Install the combustion liner tube support724269ps65021 and the keywasher724269aw03021 at location shown. Tighten the bolt with your hand.
Install the two igniter tube supports724269ps65012 with the two gaskets724269RG03012 in the compressor case at two locations shown.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC06-036)lubricating compound . Install the four keywashers724269aw03014 and the four bolts724269ab20014 on the igniter tubes supports. Torque the bolts 23 to 26 lbf.in. (2.6-2.9 Nm). Lock the keywashers.

note.para: Make sure the keywashers are correctly installed and locked.

l1item.para: Torque the combustion liner tube support bolt 100 to 150 lbf.in. (11.3-16.9 Nm). Lock the keywasher.

graphic.title: Installation of the Combustion Chamber Liner

subtask.title: Heating of the HP Diffuser Case

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69014)heating funnel on the HP diffuser case.

Heat the flange with a heat gun at 163 to 177°C (325-350°F) for approximately five minutes or until you get the necessary temperature. Use the infrared temperature gage (ES1112) to check the actual temperature.

graphic.title: Heating of the HP Diffuser Case

subtask.title: Clearance Check of the HP Vane Seal Ring in the Turbine Support Case

l1item.para: Make sure the sealing surface in the turbine support case is clean.
Install seal ring725161pr08011 in the turbine support case.

Use a ES NO. 48thickness gauge and make sure the radial clearance between the components is not more than 0.001 in. (0.03 mm) on an arc of 180 degrees or is not more than 0.002 in. (0.05 mm) on an arc of 120 degrees or is not more than 0.003 in. (0.08 mm) on an arc of 60 degrees.
If necessary, turn the seal ring until the clearance is in the limits.
Record the serviceable position of the seal ring opening in relation to the TSC.
Reject the seal ring if the clearance is not in the limits.

graphic.title: Clearance Check of the HP Vane Seal Ring in the Turbine Support Case

subtask.title:
Installation of the High Pressure Turbine Vane Ring (
)

l1item.para: On the bench, install the seal ring725161pr08011 onto the HP turbine vane ring. Align the lugs and the slots.
Install the retaining ring725162pr20011 onto the HP turbine vane ring. Turn the ring to engage the lugs and slots.
Install the (PWC69653)holder on the vane ring. Align the yellow line on the holder with the "X" mark on the retaining ring (offset hole).
Make sure the outside legs Detail 2( PWC69653) are engaged under the lugs on the vane. Tighten the thumb screw Detail 6( PWC69653) .
Tighten the torque screws Detail 7( PWC69653) to push the retaining plate into position.

caution.para: DO NOT USE ANY ADHESIVE OR WAX TO KEEP THE SEAL RING COMPRESSED. THE ADHESIVE OR WAX CAN PREVENT THE SEAL RING FROM EXPANDING AFTER INSTALLATION OF THE HPT VANE.

l1item.para: Make sure the seal rings are engaged.
Remove the heat gun and the (PWC69014) heating funnel from the HP diffuser case.
Carefully lower the HPT vane assembly725151pv02011 onto the HP diffuser case. Make sure to align the X mark to the offset hole of the diffuser case.
Remove the two (PWC64241-1) guide pins from the HP diffuser case.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the four bolts725165ab20014 equally spaced on the retaining ring. Use the (PWC68936)socket and torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69653)holder from the vane ring. Use the (PWC89835)air cooling tool and let the assembly cool to room temperature.
Retorque the four bolts to 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the remaining bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the ten (10) bolts725165ab200110 on the retaining ring. Use the (PWC68936)socket and torque the bolts in a star pattern 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Use the (PWC69553)seating gage to check the seating of the parts. The contact pin Detail 3( PWC69553) must be higher than the surface of the gage.

graphic.title:
Installation of the High Pressure Turbine Vane Ring (
)

subtask.title:
Installation of the High Pressure Turbine Vane Ring (
)

l1item.para: Identify the anti-rotation lug on the HPT vane assembly725151pv02011 and the anti-rotation slot on the seal ring725161pr08011 .
On the bench, install the seal ring725161pr08011 onto the HP turbine vane ring. Align the lugs and the slots.
Install the retaining ring725162pr20011 onto the HP turbine vane ring. Turn the ring to engage the lugs and slots.
Install the (PWC69653)holder on the vane ring. Align the yellow line on the holder with the "X" mark on the retaining ring (offset hole).
Make sure the outside legs Detail 2( PWC69653) are engaged under the lugs on the vane. Tighten the thumb screw Detail 6( PWC69653) .
Tighten the torque screws Detail 7( PWC69653) to push the retaining plate into position.

caution.para: DO NOT USE ANY ADHESIVE OR WAX TO KEEP THE SEAL RING COMPRESSED. THE ADHESIVE OR WAX CAN PREVENT THE SEAL RING FROM EXPANDING AFTER INSTALLATION OF THE HPT VANE.

l1item.para: Turn the seal ring ends so the opening is underneath one of the holder legs. Make sure the anti-rotation slot of the seal ring is engaged with the anti-rotation lug of the HPT vane assembly.
Remove the heat gun and the (PWC69014) heating funnel from the HP diffuser case.
Carefully lower the HPT vane assembly725151pv02011 onto the HP diffuser case. Make sure to align the X mark to the offset hole of the diffuser case.
Remove the two (PWC64241-1) guide pins from the HP diffuser case.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the four bolts725165ab20014 equally spaced on the retaining ring. Use the (PWC68936)socket and torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69653)holder from the vane ring. Use the (PWC89835)air cooling tool and let the assembly cool to room temperature.
Retorque the four bolts to 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the remaining bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the ten (10) bolts725165ab200110 on the retaining ring. Use the (PWC68936)socket and torque the bolts in a star pattern 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Use the (PWC69553)seating gage to check the seating of the parts. The contact pin Detail 3( PWC69553) must be higher than the surface of the gage.

graphic.title:
Installation of the High Pressure Turbine Vane Ring (
)

subtask.title: Installation of the Bottom Front Outer Bypass Duct

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69114)bypass duct protector on the bypass duct.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the thirteen (13) bolts727160ab200113 , thirteen (13) washers727160aw030113 , and thirteen (13) nuts723360an052113 . Tighten the nuts with your hand.
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bracket731130rb40071 with the long end facing the rear, the bolt727160ab20011 and the nut723360an05211 . Tighten the nut with your hand.
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bracket792130rb40151 with the long end facing the rear, the bolt727160ab20011 and the nut723360an05211 . Tighten the nut with your hand.
Torque the fifteen (15) nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Bottom Front Outer Bypass Duct

subtask.title: Installation of the Oil and P3 Bleed Air Fairings

note.para: Equivalent installation on both sides of the engine.

l1item.para: Install the two grommets727167rg17012 onto the bypass duct.
Lubricate inside diameter of the grommets with ( PWC09-003)silicone grease to make the fairings installation easier.
Install the four gaskets727167RG03014 . Make sure the gaskets are free of damage.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE STRAINER IS INSTALLED IN THE NO. 4 BEARING PRESSURE TUBE FROM THE DIFFUSER.

l1item.para: Use the (PWC68794)guide and install the fairings727167pf01022 through the grommets and align with the tube hole.

note.para: Lubricate the fairing-oil-transfer-tube opening with ( PWC03-001)engine oil to make the installation easier.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolts with (PWC06-036)anti-seize compound . Install the bolts727167ab20212 , one bolt on each fairing as shown. Tighten the bolts with your finger.

graphic.title: Installation of the Oil and P3 Bleed Air Fairings

subtask.title: Installation of the P3 Cooler

l1item.para: Install the two gaskets727103rg03012 onto the P3 cooler assembly.

note.para: Make sure the gaskets are free of damage.

l1item.para: Slide the P3 air cooler727103pc25021 down through the outer bypass duct to be installed between the P3 fairing and the compressor case.

note.para: A safety cable may be attached to the assembly aid hole to lower the P3 cooler into position.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolt with (PWC06-036)anti-seize compound . Install the bolt727167ab20311 . Torque the bolt 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).
Torque the bolt 62 to 72 lbf.in. (7.0-8.1 Nm).
Install the two gaskets727197rg03012 onto the P3 cooler assembly.

note.para: Make sure the gaskets are free of damage.

l1item.para: Slide the P3 air passage spacer727197ps33011 down through the outer bypass duct to be installed between the P3 fairing and the compressor case.

note.para: A safety cable may be attached to the assembly aid hole to lower the P3 air spacer into position.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolt with (PWC06-036)anti-seize compound . Install the bolt727167ab20311 . Torque the bolt 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).
Torque the bolt 62 to 72 lbf.in. (7.0-8.1 Nm).

: Do a check of the No. 4 bearing oil pressure tube installation in the fairing. Use a depth micrometer (0-6 in. (0-150 mm)) and measure Dim. A from the face of the fairing to the edge of the tube as shown. The maximum depth (Dim. A) acceptable is 1.5350 in. (38 mm). If the depth is more than 1.5350 in. (38 mm), remove the fairing and install it again.
Without loosening, retorque the bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).
Without loosening, retorque the bolts 62 to 72 lbf.in. (7.0-8.1 Nm).
Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing727167rp03021 on the nipple.
Install the nipple727177pn02011 on the fairing. Torque the nipple 200 to 225 lbf.in. (22.6-25.4 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the P3 Cooler

subtask.title: Assembly and Installation of the Bypass Duct Fuel Fairing

l1item.para: Assemble the drain valve as follows:

l2item.para: Install the spring727195ps44011 in the drain valve adapter727192pa03011 .
Install the drain valve727106pv01011 in the adapter.
Install the retaining ring727106ar20011 in the adapter.

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing 727179rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install on the primary fuel reducer tube727179pr02011 .
Install the reducer tube on the fuel fairing. Torque the reducer 110 to 115 lbf.in. (12.5-12.9 Nm).
Lubricate the packing 727179rp03011 with (PWC03-001)engine oil and install on the secondary fuel reducer tube 727179pr02111 .
Install the reducer tube on the fuel fairing. Torque the reducer 110 to 115 lbf.in. (12.5-12.9 Nm).

Install the gasket727106rg03011 on the drain valve adapter assembly727192PA03011 . Apply (PWC06-004) anti-seize compound to the threads and install the drain valve on the fuel fairing. Torque, 110 to 115 lbf.in. (12.5-12.9 Nm). Use the (PWC90025)crimper and install the safety cable on the drain valve. (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, TASK 70-53-00-400-102).

graphic.title: Assembly of the Bypass Duct Fuel Fairing

subtask.title: Installation of the Bypass Duct Fuel Fairing

l1item.para: Install the grommet727167rg17011 onto the bypass duct.
Lubricate inside diameter of the grommet with ( PWC09-003)silicone grease to make the fairing installation easier.
Lubricate the packings on the fuel manifold inlet with ( PWC03-001)engine oil.
Use a small amount of (PWC09-003)silicone grease to hold gasket in place during installation and install the fairing727168pf01011 with the gasket727168rg03021 through the grommet.
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bolt727168ab20121 on the fairing. Tighten the bolt with your hand.
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bolt727168ab20021 on the fairing. Tighten the bolt with your hand.
Torque the bolt 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque the bolt 85 to 95 lbf.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Bypass Duct Fuel Fairing

subtask.title: Installation of the Igniters

note.para: Equivalent installation on both sides of the engine.

l1item.para: Install the two grommets727170rg17012 onto the bypass duct.
Lubricate inside diameter of the grommets with ( PWC09-003)silicone grease to make the fairings installation easier.
Install the fairings727170pf01012 through the grommets.
Apply a thin film of (PWC06-036)lubricating compound on gasket face. Install the two gaskets742104rg03012 on the igniter.

note.para: Do not lubricate the threads of the igniters.

caution.para: IF YOU DROP OR MISHANDLE THE IGNITER REPLACE IT WITH A NEW IGNITER.

l1item.para: Install the two igniters742104pi01012 into the compressor case. Torque the igniters (DRY) 300 to 360 lbf.in. (33.9-40.6 Nm) (F & C REF. NO. 1709).

graphic.title: Installation of the Igniters

subtask.title: Installation of the Bypass Duct Protector

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69015)cover in the engine with the split at BDC.

graphic.title: Installation of the Bypass Duct Protector

subtask.title: Installation of the AGB Support Brackets

l1item.para: Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the accessory gearbox support bracket723369ps65011 with the two bolts723369ab20122 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the accessory gearbox support bracket723369ps65021 with the two bolts723369ab20112 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.

graphic.title: Installation of the AGB Support Brackets

subtask.title: Installation of the Alignment Fixture PWC47063

l1item.para: Rotate the engine to get the front of the engine to face down.
Lubricate the threads of the bolts 2( PWC47063) with (PWC06-004)antiseize compound.
Align the compressor case mount pad and install the ( PWC47063)guide with the bolts 2( PWC47063) . Torque the bolts 110 to 120 lbf.in. (12.5-13.5 Nm).
Make sure the sliding adjustments of the (PWC47063)guide are fully outward to provide clearance for the mating of the accessory gearbox.
Lower the accessory gearbox and attach the gearbox to the (PWC47063)guide with the nuts 9( PWC47063) . Torque the nuts 150 to 170 lbf.in. (17-19 Nm).

note.para: Before you install the AGB assembly, make sure there is no oil in the assembly. Drain if necessary.

graphic.title: Installation of the Alignment Fixture PWC47063

subtask.title: Alignment Check of the Accessory Gearbox

l1item.para: Rotate the engine to get the engine horizontal to allow a vertical installation of the accessory gearbox.
Install the (PWC47064)alignment sleeve into the accessory gearbox.
Use the (PWC47063)guide large adjusting wheel and slowly lower the AGB. Use the (PWC47063)guide sliding adjustments and align the (PWC47064) alignment sleeve with the compressor case .

caution.para: DO NOT CHANGE THE SLIDING ADJUSTMENTS OF THE ( PWC47063)GUIDE.

l1item.para: When the AGB is correctly aligned, use the (PWC47063) guide large adjusting wheel and raise the AGB.
Remove the (PWC47064)alignment sleeve from the accessory gearbox.

graphic.title: Alignment Check of the Accessory Gearbox

subtask.title: Mating of the Accessory Gearbox

l1item.para: Install the vibration damper726167pd02021 on the compressor case.

Lubricate the packing with (PWC06-011)assembly fluid . Make sure the outer diameter of the packing is lubricated with (PWC06-011) assembly fluid. Install the packing726167rp03011 on the compressor case.
Install the vibration damper726167pd02011 on the compressor case.
Apply (PWC06-011) assembly fluid on the pinion gear at the gear mesh location.
Apply (PWC06-011) assembly fluid inside the pinion gear AGB mating bore.

caution.para: DO NOT CHANGE THE SLIDING ADJUSTMENTS OF THE ( PWC47063)GUIDE.

l1item.para: Use the (PWC47063)guide large adjusting wheel and slowly lower the AGB onto the compressor case. Make sure the gears mesh correctly and continue lowering the AGB until it is fully seated.

note.para: You can view the gears meshing through the FMU mounting pad.

graphic.title: Mating of the Accessory Gearbox

subtask.title: Attachment of the Accessory Gearbox

l1item.para: Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the bolts. Install the four bolts723369ab20024 to secure the accessory gearbox to the engine. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

note.para: Similar on both sides of AGB.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC47063)guide from the engine.
Install the (PWC69625)alignment tool with the slave bolts on the AGB and the nipple. Tighten the bolts and nut coupling with your hand.
Make sure alignment tool is aligned with the AGB. If necessary, adjust the AGB bolts and brackets. If necessary remove some tension with the (PWC47063)guide adjustment wheel and sliding adjusters.
Torque the four bolts 45 to 60 lbf.in. (5.1-6.8 Nm). Use the (PWC90025)crimper and install the safety cables on the bolts. (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, TASK 70-53-00-400-102).
Torque the four bolts 125 to 140 lbf.in. (14.1-15.8 Nm).
Remove the (PWC69625)alignment tool from the engine.

graphic.title: Attachment of the Accessory Gearbox

l1item.para: Continue to assemble engine components per 72-00-01, Installation-03 (Task 72-00-01-430-803).

task.title: Installation of the Engine Components (Right-side Assembler)

l1item.para: Refer to the general installation procedures per 72-00-00, Installation-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-801).
Refer to Inspection/Check-00 (Task 72-00-00-220-801) for the fits and clearances numbers given in this procedure.
Refer to 72-00-00 Assembly-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-802) flowcharts for the sequence of tasks to follow for the complete assembly of the engine.
Install the Engine Components per 72-00-01, Installation-02 (Task 72-00-01-430-802).

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Preparation Before Assembly

note.para: Before you put a part in the oven, make sure the part can be installed immediately when removed from the oven.

l1item.para: Put the No.5 bearing seal runner725247pr32011 in oven at 176°C (350°F) for fifteen (15) to thirty (30) minutes maximum.
Put the roller bearing725218pb06011 in oven at 176°C (350°F) for fifteen (15) to thirty (30) minutes maximum.

graphic.title: Preparation Before Assembly

subtask.title: Installation of the Primary and Secondary Fuel Tubes

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing731130rp03051 on the secondary fuel tube.
Install the secondary fuel tube assembly731130pt17051 on the FMU and the bypass duct fuel fairing secondary nozzle. Tighten the coupling nut with your hand.

caution.para: HOLD THE NIPPLE TIGHTLY WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two bolts731130ab20052 on the secondary fuel tube assembly. Torque the coupling nut 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm). Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing731130rp03031 on the primary fuel tube.
Install the primary fuel tube assembly731130pt17031 on the FMU and the bypass duct fuel fairing primary nozzle. Tighten the coupling nut with your hand.

caution.para: HOLD THE NIPPLE TIGHTLY WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two bolts731130ab20032 on the primary fuel tube assembly. Torque the coupling nut 90 to 100 lbf.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm). Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Primary and Secondary Fuel Tubes

subtask.title: Installation of the No.1 To No.3 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing727167rp03021 on the reducer.
Install the reducer727178pr02011 on the compressor case. Torque the reducer 200 to 225 lbf.in. (22.6-25.4 Nm).
Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing792130rp03051 on the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube.
Lubricate the threads of the coupling nut with ( PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube792130pt17051 on the compressor case. Tighten the coupling nut with your hand.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the two bolts792130ab20052 on the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

graphic.title: Installation of the No.1 To No.3 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube

subtask.title: Installation of the Air Cooled Oil Cooler to Fuel Oil Heat Exchanger Oil Pressure Tube

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing792130rp03091 on the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube.

Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound to the threads of the bolts and lubricate the coupling nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube792130pt17091 with the two bolts792130ab20092 . Tighten the bolts and the coupling nut with your hand.

graphic.title: Installation of the Air Cooled Oil Cooler to Fuel Oil Heat Exchanger Oil Pressure Tube

subtask.title: Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube

l1item.para: Lubricate the threads of the coupling nuts with ( PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube792130pt17021 on the tee fitting of the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube and the reducer on the compressor case. Tighten the coupling nuts with your hand.

graphic.title: Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube

subtask.title: Clamping of the Tubes

l1item.para: Install the four clamps792130rc0709792130rc07054 on the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube and the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube as shown. Lubricate the two bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Attach the clamps with the bolts792130ab20052 and the two nuts792130an05052 on the brackets. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install the two clamps792130rc0709792130rc07152 on the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube and the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube as shown. Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Attach the clamps with the bolt792130ab20051 and the nut792130an05051 on the bracket. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: Make sure the clamps are installed on the opposite side of the bracket.

l1item.para: Torque the two bolts of the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).
Torque the two bolts of the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).

caution.para: HOLD ADJACENT FITTING IN POSITION WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT OR DAMAGE TO THE PARTS CAN OCCUR.

l1item.para: Torque the coupling nut of the ACOC to FOHE oil pressure tube 450 to 500 lbf.in. (50.8-56.5 Nm). Install the safety cable with the ( PWC90025)crimper on the coupling nut (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, Task 70-53-00-400-102).

caution.para: HOLD ADJACENT FITTING IN POSITION WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT OR DAMAGE TO THE PARTS CAN OCCUR.

l1item.para: Torque the coupling nuts of the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm). Install the safety cables with the (PWC90025)crimper on the coupling nuts (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, Task 70-53-00-400-102).

caution.para: HOLD ADJACENT FITTING IN POSITION WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT OR DAMAGE TO THE PARTS CAN OCCUR.

l1item.para: Torque the coupling nut of the No.1 to No.3 bearing oil pressure tube 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm). Install the safety cable with the (PWC90025)crimper on the coupling nut (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, Task 70-53-00-400-102).

graphic.title: Clamping of the Tubes

subtask.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Seal Runner and Roller Bearing

caution.para: WEAR PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN YOU TOUCH HOT PARTS.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69122)protector and (PWC66886-8)protector on the LP turbine disk assembly.
Install the (PWC69660)guide on the LP compressor shaft.
Remove the No.5 bearing seal runner725247pr32011 from the oven and install on the LP compressor shaft.
Remove the (PWC69660)guide and install the (PWC69842) rod on the LP compressor shaft.

Install the (PWC68417)drift, the (PWC71392) adapter, the (PWC89837) cylinder, the nut detail 2( PWC69842) , and the ( PWC37807)pump on the No.5 bearing seal runner. Apply a load of 2800 to 2950 psi (19305-20340 kPa). Keep the load until the part is at room temperature.

Release the pressure and remove the (PWC37807) pump, the nut detail 2( PWC69842) , the (PWC89837)cylinder, the ( PWC71392)adapter and the (PWC68417)drift. Do not remove the (PWC69122)protector and (PWC66886-8)protector
Remove the (PWC69842)rod and install the (PWC69660) guide on the LP compressor shaft.
Remove the roller bearing725218pb06011 from the oven and install on the LP compressor shaft.

note.para: Make sure the serial number is facing down as shown.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69660)guide and install the (PWC69842) rod on the LP compressor shaft.

Install the (PWC68417)drift, the (PWC71392) adapter, the (PWC89837) cylinder, the nut detail 2( PWC69842) , and the ( PWC37807)pump on the roller bearing . Apply a load of 2800 to 2950 psi (19305-20340 kPa). Keep the load until the part is at room temperature.

Release the pressure and remove the (PWC37807) pump, the nut detail 2( PWC69842) , the (PWC89837)cylinder, the ( PWC71392)adapter and the (PWC68417)drift. Do not remove the (PWC69122)protector and (PWC66886-8)protector .

graphic.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Seal Runner and Roller Bearing

subtask.title: Installation of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt

l1item.para: Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the LP shaft retaining bolt725298pb20011 , the LP compressor shaft, the bolt thrust face and the mating face of the LP turbine cup washer725298aw03011 .

note.para: Remove unwanted compound wherever possible.

l1item.para: Install the LP shaft retaining bolt725298pb20011 with the LP turbine cup washer on the LP compressor shaft. Tighten the bolt with your hand
Align the anti-rotation lug and install the ( PWC69125)holder onto the LP turbine disk.
Prepare the (PWC69694)wrench as follows:

note.para: The angle torque wrench must remain level and motionless while it is cycling through the calibration sequence in the steps that follow.

l2item.para: Push the "Check/C" button; the tool will beep and go through its calibration sequence. The Display will read "Track lbf.in."
Push the "M/R" button; the display will read "Setup".
Push the "Right arrow" button four times; the display will read "Multi-presets".
Push the "Check/C" button once; the display will read "Edit presets".
Push the "right arrow" button once; the display will read "Auto presets".
Push the "Check/C" button once and wait; the display will read "Macro lbf.in.".
The tool is ready for use.

note.para: The angle torque wrench is pre-programmed with the torque steps. While applying torque a steady yellow light will appear. When the target is reached a steady green light will appear. If a red light appears, the target has been exceeded. When the green light appears, release the pressure on the handle and the display will lock. To proceed, press "Check/C" button. To turn off, press and hold the "Check/C" button for 5 seconds. Do not use the torque wrench to untorque the bolt.

graphic.title: Installation of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt

subtask.title: Torquing of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt

l1item.para: Use the (PWC69694)wrench and torque the bolt as follows (Ref. F&C REF. NO. 1703):

l2item.para: Torque bolt 25 to 35 lbf.in. (2.8-3.9 Nm). The green light will appear when you get to the target torque. Release pressure on the torque wrench handle and press "Check/C" button.
Make a reference mark with a (PWC05-018)pencil on the cup washer and the bearing. Make sure the tabs of the cup washer are not broken.

caution.para: DO NOT EXCEED 400 LBF.IN (45 NM).

l2item.para: Apply sufficient torque to turn the bolt 13 to 16 degrees more. The green light will appear when you get to the target torque.

If you get to the 400 lbf.in. (45 Nm) before the angle torque, remove the parts and check for binding or damage. If no damage, Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolt, the LP compressor shaft, the bolt thrust face and the mating face of the cupwasher and repeat steps (a) and (c). If torque is below 400 lbf.in., proceed to step (e).

caution.para: DO NOT USE (PWC69694)WRENCH TO LOOSEN THE BOLT.

l2item.para: Loosen the LP shaft retaining bolt to 0 lbf.in. (0 Nm); press the "Check/C" button, repeat step (a).
Apply sufficient torque to turn the bolt 17 to 20 degrees more. The green light will appear when you get to the target torque. Record the torque value.

caution.para: DO NOT USE (PWC69694)WRENCH TO LOOSEN THE BOLT.

l2item.para: If the final torque is below 116 lbf.in. (18 Nm), loosen the LP shaft retaining bolt to 0 lbf.in. (0 Nm). Repeat steps (a), (c) thru (f).
If final torque exceeds 500 lbf.in. (56 Nm), remove the parts and check for binding or damage.

If no damage, clean parts and apply (PWC06-004)antiseize compound on the threads of the bolt, the LP compressor shaft, the bolt thrust face and the mating face of the cupwasher. Repeat torque procedure steps (a) thru (h).
If damage is found, replace the parts with new ones and repeat steps (a) thru (i). Make sure the reference marks are aligned. Record the final torque.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC66886-8)protector and the (PWC69122) protector from the blade of the LP turbine disk.
Remove the (PWC69694)wrench and the (PWC69125) holder from the LP Turbine disk.

graphic.title: Torquing of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt

subtask.title: Radial Runout of the LP Turbine

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69165)gage on the (PWC69018) clamping tool.
Turn the engine 30 degrees nose down.
Measure and record the radial runout at location shown. Make sure you have a maximum of 0.0015 in. (0.0381 mm).
Measure and record the radial runout high point angle as follows:

l2item.para: The zero degree is located between the Y marks on the LPT disk and the angle is increasing in a counterclockwise direction when looking at the trailing edge.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69165)gage from the (PWC69018) clamping tool.

graphic.title: Radial Runout of the LP Turbine

subtask.title: Axial Runout of the LP Turbine

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69020)locator and the (PWC69018) clamping tool.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE GAGE IS CLEAN AND MATING SURFACES ARE FREE FROM BURRS OR DAMAGE.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69298)gage on the (PWC69018)clamping tool.
Measure and record the axial runout at location shown. Make sure you have a maximum of 0.0015 in. (0.0381 mm).
Measure and record the axial runout high point angle as follows:

l2item.para: The zero degree is located between the Y marks on the LPT disk and the angle is increasing in a counterclockwise direction when looking at the trailing edge.

l1item.para: Remove the (PWC69298)gage from the (PWC69018) clamping tool. Turn the engine to a vertical position.

graphic.title: Axial Runout of the LP Turbine

subtask.title: Crimping of the Low Pressure Shaft Cupwasher

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69122)protector on the LP turbine disk.
Lubricate the lugs of the (PWC69466) crimper with (PWC03-001)engine oil.
Align the (PWC69466)crimper with the scallops on the bolt. Crimp the cupwasher into the scallops of the LP shaft retaining bolt in two places.
Stake the cupwasher. The clearance must not be more than 0.005 in. (0.1 mm) maximum on the staking of the cupwasher at both locations.
Remove the (PWC69122)protector from the LP Turbine disk.

graphic.title: Crimping of the Low Pressure Shaft Cupwasher

subtask.title: Axial Measurement of the LP Compressor Shaft

l1item.para: Turn the engine to the vertical position.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE GAGE IS CLEAN AND MATING SURFACES ARE FREE FROM BURRS OR DAMAGE.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69021)gage on the (PWC69020)locator .
Measure and record the dimension AE between the top of the LP shaft retaining bolt and the top of the compressor case.
Remove the (PWC69021)gage and the (PWC69020) locator from the (PWC69018) clamping tool.

graphic.title: Axial Measurement of the LP Compressor Shaft

subtask.title: Adjustment of the Fuel Shutoff Valve Pin

l1item.para: Install the (PWC68943)protector on the turbine exhaust case.
Install the (PWC69544)tensioner on the fuel shutoff cable.
Retrieve Dim. AE (Ref. Subtask 72-00-01-220-001).
Calculate the dimension as follows:Dim AG = Dim AE + 0.050 in. (1.27 mm)

note.para: Record the Dim. AG.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69028)wrench on the fuel shutoff valve pin.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THE GAGE IS CLEAN AND MATING SURFACES ARE FREE FROM BURRS OR DAMAGE.
MAKE SURE THAT A SLIGHT RESISTANCE IS DETECTED BY TURNING THE PIN IN THE SEAL BY A QUARTER OF A TURN.

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69029)gage on the turbine exhaust case.
With the (PWC69028)wrench, adjust the fuel shutoff valve pin height to the required position. Make sure the dimension AG is ±0.004 in. (0.10 mm) of the calculated Dim. AG (Ref. Step (4)).
Remove the (PWC69029)gage from the turbine exhaust case.
Remove the (PWC69028)wrench from the fuel shutoff valve pin.
Install the keywasher725554aw03011 with tab up.

note.para: If necessary, use the (PWC69028) wrench and turn the fuel shutoff valve pin to permit the washer to engage in the nearest turbine exhaust case slot.

l1item.para: Use the (PWC90176)plier and install the retaining ring725554ar20011 .
Install the (PWC69029)gage on the turbine exhaust case.
Record the actual Dim. AG. Make sure the dimension AG is ±0.004 in. (0.10 mm) of the calculated Dim. AG.

graphic.title: Adjustment of the Fuel Shutoff Valve Pin

subtask.title: Preparation for Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case

l1item.para: Install the (PWC69606)funnel on a stand. Install the turbine exhaust case assembly in the funnel.

Heat the forward flange with a heat gun at 163 to 177°C (325-350°F) for approximately ten minutes or until you get the necessary temperature. Use the infrared temperature gage (ES1112) to check the actual temperature.
Remove the (PWC69018)clamping tool from the TSC flange.
Install the three (PWC64241-14) guide pins in the compressor case flange.

caution.para: WEAR CLEAN COTTON GLOVES WHEN YOU TOUCH THE BEARING.

l1item.para: Apply (PWC06-011) assembly fluid on the No.5 roller bearing. Seat the rollers radially inward.

graphic.title: Preparation for Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case

l1item.para: Continue to assemble engine components per 72-00-01, Installation-04 (Task 72-00-01-430-804).

Installation of the Primary and Secondary Fuel Tubes
Installation of the No.1 To No.3 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube
Installation of the Air Cooled Oil Cooler to Fuel Oil Heat Exchanger Oil Pressure Tube
Installation of the No.4 Bearing Oil Pressure Tube
Clamping of the Tubes
Installation of the No.5 Bearing Seal Runner and Roller Bearing
Installation of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt
Torquing of the Low Pressure Shaft Retaining Bolt
Radial Runout of the LP Turbine
Axial Runout of the LP Turbine
Crimping of the Low Pressure Shaft Cupwasher
Axial Measurement of the LP Compressor Shaft
Adjustment of the Fuel Shutoff Valve Pin
Preparation for Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case

task.title: Installation of the Engine Components (Right-side Assembler)

l1item.para: Refer to the general installation procedures per 72-00-00, Installation-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-801).
Refer to 72-00-00 Assembly-00 (Task 72-00-00-400-802) flowcharts for the sequence of tasks to follow for the complete assembly of the engine.
Install the Engine Components per 72-00-01, Installation-03 (Task 72-00-01-430-803).

warning.para: READ THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS BEFORE YOU USE THESE MATERIALS. SOME MATERIALS CAN BE DANGEROUS.

subtask.title: Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case Bottom

note.para: Do this subtask at the same time as (Subtask 72-00-02-430-027).

l1item.para: Align the scallops and install the turbine exhaust case assembly squarely onto the turbine support case with extreme care.
Install the (PWC69105)template on the turbine exhaust case.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the thirty (30) bolts725561ab200130 on the exhaust case at the locations shown. Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Remove the (PWC69105)template from the turbine exhaust case.
Install the (PWC69594)protector on the turbine exhaust case.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the six brackets725560rb40016 on the bottom half of the turbine exhaust case at the locations shown and the twelve (12) bolts725561ab200112 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the transducer vibration bracket assembly727193pb40211 and the two bolts725561ab20022 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Remove the (PWC69015)protector from the outer bypass duct flange.

graphic.title: Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case Bottom

subtask.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing792230rp03021 on the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube.

Lubricate the coupling nut of the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube with (PWC03-001) engine oil. Install the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube792230pt17021 and the fairing assembly727169pf01011 on the AGB and the exhaust case. Tighten the coupling nuts with your hand.
Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the two bolts792230ab20022 on the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bracket792230rb40021 with the short leg on flange and the long tab facing rearward. Attach the bracket with the (PWC05-361)cable strap . Install the clamp792230rc07021 on the tube. Attach the clamp with the bolt792130ab20031 and the nut792130an05031 on the bracket. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

note.para: The (PWC05-361) cable strap will be removed in the test cell when the cover and test equipment is installed to the cold start valve.

l1item.para: Torque the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).

caution.para: HOLD THE FITTINGS TIGHTLY WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUT.

l1item.para: Torque the coupling nut of the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube

subtask.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Pressure Oil Tubes

l1item.para: Lubricate the coupling nuts of the No.5 bearing oil pressure tube with (PWC03-001) engine oil. Install the No.5 bearing oil pressure tube792130pt17031 on the tee fitting of the No.4 bearing oil pressure tube and on the exhaust case. Tighten the coupling nuts with your hand.
Lubricate the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the bracket792130rb40031 with the nut792130an05031 on the engine case stud. Torque the nut 32 to 36 lbf.in. (3.7-4.1 Nm).

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp792130rc07031 on the tube. Attach the clamp with the bolt792130ab20031 and the nut792130an05031 on the bracket. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp792130rc07031 on the tube. Attach the clamp with the bolt792130ab20031 and the nut792130an05031 on the bracket. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

caution.para: HOLD THE FITTINGS TIGHTLY WHEN YOU TORQUE THE COUPLING NUTS.

l1item.para: Torque the coupling nuts of the No.5 bearing oil pressure tube 270 to 300 lbf.in. (30.5-33.9 Nm). Install the safety cables on the coupling nuts (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, Task 70-53-00-400-102).

graphic.title: Installation of the No.5 Bearing Pressure Oil Tubes

subtask.title: Installation of the Air Breather Tube Bracket

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the air breather tube bracket723268pb40051 with the two bolts727169ab20012 , two washers727169aw03012 and two nuts727169an05012 on the bypass duct flange. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp792230rc07021 on the No.5 bearing oil scavenge tube with the bolt792230ab20021 and the nut792230an05021 . Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Air Breather Tube Bracket

subtask.title: Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case Cowl Bottom

note.para: Do this step at the same time as the other side of the engine.

l1item.para: Install six clip nuts725560an05016 onto the exhaust case flange brackets.
Apply (PWC09-003) silicone compound on the cowl damper rubber.
Install the cowl725560pc40011 on the turbine exhaust case.

note.para: Make sure the cowl damper rubber is engage into the service fairing groove.

l1item.para: Apply (PWC06-009) antiseize compound on the threads of the bolts. Install the six bolts725560ab20016 , and the six washers725560aw03216 on the cowl. Tighten the bolts with your hand.

note.para: Make sure there is a minimum gap of 0.100 in. (2.54 mm) all around the cowl.

l1item.para: Use the (PWC68936)socket and torque from TDC to service fairing the six bolts 44 to 48 lbf.in. (5.0-5.8 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Turbine Exhaust Case Cowl Bottom

subtask.title: Installation of the Rear Flange Brackets

l1item.para: Install the bracket731130rb40041 on the rear flange as shown. Attach the bracket with (PWC05-361)cable strap.
Install the bracket731130rb40061 on the rear flange as shown. Attach the bracket with (PWC05-361)cable strap.

graphic.title: Installation of the Rear Flange Brackets

subtask.title: Installation of the Service Fairing

l1item.para: Install the bypass duct seal727173ps06011 on the fairing.
Install the bypass duct seal retainer727181pr03011 on the fairing.

Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound on the bolts. Install the four bolts727181ab20014 with the four washers727181aw03014 on the bypass duct seal retainer. Torque the bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Service Fairing

subtask.title: Rigging of the Fuel Shutoff Valve Cable

caution.para: DO NOT TWIST THE CORE OF THE CABLE DURING AND AFTER THE INSTALLATION OR DAMAGE TO THE PART CAN OCCUR.

l1item.para: If the tail cone725553PC15011 is installed, use the (PWC68936)socket and remove the five bolts725553AB20015 and the tail cone from the turbine exhaust case. Make sure the FSOV cable is not in contact with the No. 5 oil tube clamps.
Turn the jam nut loosely onto the cable.
Install the washer onto the cable.
Install the cable through the FMU bracket and engage the ball end into the lever.
Install the cotter pin761106ap04111 in the FMU rod.

note.para: Gently turn the piston to make it easier to install the cotter pin. After the cotter pin is installed, return the piston to the original position.

l1item.para: Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp761106rc07011 with the bolt761106ab20011 and the nut761106an05011 on the cable. Tighten the nut with your hand.
Adjust cable fitting until the (PWC69592) rigging pin engages the groove in the ESOV piston through the rigging hole in the housing. Make sure the shoulder of the pin contacts the housing.
Torque the jam nut 24 to 36 lbf.in. (2.7-4.1 Nm).
Torque the clamp nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Check again the for proper adjustment with the ( PWC69592)rigging pin.
Install the safety cable on the two jam nuts (Ref. Standard Practices Manual P/N 585005, Task 70-53-00-400-102).
Do a visual inspection to make sure the FSOV cable is not in contact with the No. 5 oil tube clamps. Adjust if necessary.

Install the tail cone725553PC15011 on the turbine exhaust case. Apply (PWC06-004) antiseize compound to the bolts. Install the five bolts725553AB20015 on the tail cone. Use the (PWC68936) socket and torque the bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).

graphic.title: Rigging of the Fuel Shutoff Valve Cable

subtask.title: Installation of the Flowmeter Tubes

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing731130rp03041 on the flowmeter to FMU fuel tube.
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the flowmeter to FMU fuel tube731130pt17041 on the FMU with the two bolts731130ab20042 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.
Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing731130rp03061 on the FMU to flowmeter tube.
Install the FMU to flowmeter tube731130pt17061 on the FMU with the two bolts731130ab20062 . Tighten the bolts with your hand.

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the three loop cushion clamps731130rc07043 with the three bolts731130ab20043 and the three nuts731130an05043 on the flowmeter to FMU fuel tube. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two loop cushion clamps731130rc07062 with the two bolts731130ab20062 and the two nuts731130an05062 on the FMU to flowmeter tube. Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque the four bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Flowmeter Tubes

subtask.title: Installation of the T6 Junction Box

l1item.para: Lubricate the threads of the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the two terminals (Ground, Black) with the nut772111an05011 and the bolt772111ab20011 on the T6 junction box as shown. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Lubricate the threads of the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the T6 junction box with the nut772111an05011 on the bracket. Torque the nut 32 to 36 lbf.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm).

Lubricate the threads of the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the two terminals (green) on the junction box as shown. Install the nut773104an05111 on the T6 junction box. Torque the nut 25 to 30 lbf.in. (2.8-3.3 Nm).

Lubricate the threads of the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil . Install the two terminals (white) on the T6 junction box with the nut773104an05011 as shown. Torque the nut 20 to 25 lbf.in. (2.3-2.8 Nm).
Install the bracket773104RB40011 on the service fairing. Secure with a (PWC05-361) tie-strap.
Install the clamp773104RC07011 on the T6 wiring harness. Install the clamp to the bracket with the bolt773104AB20011 and the nut773104AN05211 . Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the T6 Junction Box

subtask.title: Clamping of the Main Electrical Wiring Harness Bottom

l1item.para: Lubricate the nut with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp761104rc07411 and the nut761104an05011 . Torque the nut 32 to 36 lbf.in. (3.7-4.1 Nm).
Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp761104rc07011 with the bolt761104ab20011 and the nut761104an05011 . Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Lubricate the bolts with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the two clamps761104rc07012 with the two bolts761104ab20012 and the two nuts761104an05012 . Torque the nuts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp761104rc07211 on the wiring harness. Secure the clamp to the J-clamp on the No. 5 bearing tube with the bolt761104ab20011 and the nut761104an05011 . Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Clamping of the Main Electrical Wiring Harness Bottom

subtask.title: Installation of the Air Breather Tube

l1item.para: Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing753130rp03011 on the air breather tube.
Lubricate the packing with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the packing753130rp03011 on the air breather tube.
Install the air breather tube753130pt17011 on the AGB and service fairing.

Lubricate the bolt with (PWC03-001)engine oil. Install the clamp753130rc07011 on the air breather tube. Attach the clamp with the bolt753130ab20011 and the nut753130an05011 to the bracket. Torque the nut 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

graphic.title: Installation of the Air Breather Tube

l1item.para: Test the engine per 72-00-00, Testing-00 (Task 72-00-00-700-801).
